64501.name: Gas Rashun
64501.description: Another game from World War II based on gas rationing. Players attempt to find sufficient amounts of gas to get through another month's worth of doing the neccessities of daily living. Roll and Move Track Game.

64502.name: Movie Millions
64502.description: A Movie Board Game. (From the box cover "The Glamorous Game") where you attempt to put together a cast of stars for 1 of 7 different kinds of Movies. Drama, Operetta, Musical, Romance, Comedy, Mystery and Western along with the correct Director to match. Featured the pictures of some of the most famous Hollywood Actors and Actresses of the times.

64503.name: Golf
64503.description: Golf From Milton Bradley one of the first Golf Games ever published. No other info on this game is availble. If you know anything about the game please add to this description. I have a picture of the game box but no description of how the game was played

64505.name: Monopoly: Boston Red Sox Collector's Edition
64505.description:
For the die-hard Red Sox fan, could there possibly be anything better than a box seat at Fenway Pak for the World Series Championship? Until that elusive day arrives, the Monopoly brand is proud to present the Boston Red Sox Collector's Edition of the world's most famous board game. Commemorating one of the most storied ball clubs in Major League Baseball, this Monopoly game is a must-have collectible for the serious (and patient) fan of the illustrious Boston Red Sox.

This collector's game captures and brings to life the glory of the Olde Towne Team. Home to some of the greatest moments in baseball history, Fenway Park and its players continue to make for exciting play in this classic game of risk taking and deal making. "Fenway Faithful" can now buy, sell and trade the best of the Red Sox, and own it all - up to, but not including - # 6!

64509.name: Green Day: Playing with Matches
64509.description:
A card game revolving around the rock band "Green Day." It is a combination of the game Memory and a trivia game, based on knowledge about the band.

Played by shuffling the deck and placing all non-answer cards face down on the table. The youngest player starts by turning over any 2 cards in an attempt to find a match. If they do not match, they are turned back over. If a match is found, that player attempts to answer the questions on the cards. Play passes clockwise around the table. Correct matches receive two points and correct answers to the trivia questions receive 1 point. Players who answer both questions correctly get to take another turn. Once all cards have been matched, the player with the highest score wins.

64512.name: The Poker-Reno Game
64512.description:
A poker dice game...

This game is a variation of Yahtzee, using poker dice. Instead of 1-6 at the top of the score sheet, this game has Aces, Jacks, Queens, Kings, Nines and Tens. Scores are recorded the same way as in Yahtzee, following the 1st, 2nd or 3rd roll, in the order shown above, scoring is 1 each, 2, 3, 4, 9 & 10. A bonus of 44 is scored if the total in the section above is at least 87 (an average of 3 dice each category.)

In the bottom scoring section, Poker-Reno is similar to Yahtzee, but scores 60 points. Fortune works the same way as Chance. 2 Pair of Same Color, and 3 of a Kind score the total of all dice, Full House scores the total of all dice + 45, and Straight (5 consecutive) scores 50.

The instructions state that any amount of players may play the game, but the score sheet is designed for no more than 6.

64513.name: Śladami Papieża
boardgamepublisher: Wydawnictwo Diecezjalne i Drukarnia w Sandomierzu
64513.description: This children's game was designed to promote the knowledge of Pope John Paul II. Players are journalists who travel around the world using simple roll and move mechanics. From time to time they are allowed to answer some questions from question cards. Correct answers provide the players with tokens. There is one letter on every token. The goal is to collect certain sentences built of the letters.

64514.name: Dragon (Issue 52 - Aug 1981)
rpgissuearticle: from the editors old and new
Knock, Knock! The history of siege warfare
Leomund's Tiny Hut: Adding depth to the Flanaess
Party Picture Contest: In the eye of the beholder
The Role of the Cleric: Warriors With Wisdom
Up on a Soapbox I: To err is human, to repair divine
Up on a Soapbox II: The best DMs will look further than the book
WANTED: I: Not a Very Nice Guy
WANTED: II: Beware of Traps in Woods
WANTED: III: He's On Your Trail
64514.description:
Vol. VI No. 2 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Boris Vallejo.

This issue had an interview with Boris Vallejo, a GAMMA WORLD adventure, and a special section on clerics in AD&D.

64515.name: Bet-a-Million
64515.description:
Break the bank... Be a Millionaire

Your "Bet a Million" game will give you many pleasurable evenings at home gatherings and parties. You are supplied with complete equipment to play three most fascinating games; Roulette, Nevada Craps and Chuck-a-Luck, exactly as played in the most renowned international casinos. In addition, you are given platic chips or counters in 8 colors and One Million Dollars in play money.

Two bankers are needed for this game so that two games can be conducted at once. One conducts either Roulette or Nevada Craps while the other conducts Chuck-a-Luck. The bankers start out with 1/3 of the money, with the rest divided amongst the players.

Felt layouts are included for the gaming tables along with a nice 8-1/2" plastic Roulette Wheel.

64517.name: Dragon (Issue 53 - Sep 1981)
rpgissuearticle: He's got a lot to kick about!
How to give disease a fighting chance
Larger Than Life: The Bogatyrs of old Kiev
Leomund's Tiny Hut: "Just" a door? Not anymore!
Some universal rules:Making your own campaign - and making it work
The Oracle: When he talks, everybody listens
The Rasmussen Files: "The item you want is temporarily out of stock..."
Up on a Soapbox: Adventuring with shaky hands: Where there's a will, there's a way to play
64517.description:
Vol. VI No. 3 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Clyde Caldwell.

This issue featured the First Place winning adventure for the International Dungeon Design Contest II - Advaced Division, "The Garden of Nefaron" and a section featuring the Monk in Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (1st Edition).

64518.name: Picture Pairs Matching Game
64518.description:
Develops concentration and problem-solving skills.

This colorful game encourages young children to recognize and match objects, skills they will need when they learn to read and write. Players identify the familiar pictures of everyday objects shown on the lotto cards and match them to similar pictures on the game boards.

There are many different ways to play, and each version is progressively more difficult. The materials in this game can be used for story telling, as well as for sorting and organizing.

64520.description:
Gongor Whist is a solitaire trick-taking game in which you try to win tricks against a dummy hand.
The trump is randomly determined by flipping over an Ace, but with every trick you have the option of randomly determining a new trump.

Each pass through the deck is two hands; each hand uses about half the cards.

The goal is to successfully make all the possible bids without repeating any of them.


Rules at the Decktet Wiki
64520.name: Gongor Whist

64522.name: Whirlpool
64522.description:
6 blue, red and yellow balls are supplied. The game has a big spinning wheel in the center. Each of the four corners, outside the circle, is called a Bank and each Bank contains five holes in which the balls won in play are placed.

Each player selects a corner Bank. The balls are placed in the corresponding color holes inside the game center. The first player spins the arrow and the others follow in turn clockwise. Each turn consists of 1 spin. If a colored ball is pointed at, and their is room, it is moved to the players Bank. The winner is the first player to win balls in this order 1=red, 2=blue, 3=yellow, 4=red or blue, 5=red or blue (whichever was not won in the 4th position.)

This game also plays another version called Merry-Go-Round. This game plays the same, but does not require the balls to be won in any specific sequence.

64524.name: A Magical Medieval City Guide
rpghonor: 2003 ENnie for Best Electronic Product - Gold Winner
2003 ENnie for Best Free Product or Web Enhancement - Gold Winner
64524.description:
From the book's Introduction:

In the two months since the release of A Magical Medieval Society: Western Europe, we at Expeditious Retreat Press have fielded more questions concerning cities than other questions combined. Because of this tremendous interest in city creation and the utter lack of material to support needy GMs, we've decided to gather all the city specific information from A Magical Medieval Society: Western Europe into one free product. A Magical Medieval City Guide is the complete thired and fourth chapters from A Magical Medieval Soceity: Western Europe and we believe it is the most useful free product so far produced for d20.

64525.name: A Magical Society: Guide to Mapping
64525.description:
From the book's Introduction:

Welcome to A Magical Society: Guide to Mapping, a free 37-page PDF that helps people make maps for plausible worlds. Taken from a macro perspective, the mapping guide goes through nine steps, each step illustrated with examples, supporting text, and a sample world map.

This free product is a collection of the three mapping sections in a larger work, A Magical Society: Ecology and Culture. Within those covers you will find help filling your world with biomes, ecological wonders, and cultural groups.

64526.name: The Pumpkin Patch
64526.description:
From the book's Introduction:

Visions is Arcane Runes Press' new line of sourcebooks dealing with folklore, legend and myth. Each sourcebook in the series will present fresh new rules, spells, magic items, monsters or prestige classes dealing with the most compelling elements of real world mythology.

What follows is a grab bag of new spells, new monsters, new magic items and new personalities, all themed around the pumpkin, and more specifically, the jack o' lantern.

64527.name: Phantasmal Memories
64527.description:
From the book's Introduction:

Phantasmal Memories - the Book of Spirits is a brand new sourcebook that expands the nature of incorporeal undead within the d20 system. Drawing up myth, legend, and popular fiction, it introduces three new templates - complete with example monsters drawn from folklore, and non-player characters inspired by the phantasms of gothic fiction - and a brand new category of spectral effect, the phantom memory. Using this book, you will be able to add whole new levels of gothic dread to your campaign world, and take your player's ghost-hunting adventurers to new heights of fear.

64528.name: Stitches
64528.description:
From the book's Introduction:

Promethean science is a catchall term for the pseudo-science of Victorian literature, and modern day science fiction, that focused on the quest for the secret of creating life. The rules presented here are intentionally simple; the purpose of this sourcebook is not to create an entirely new system of science as magic, or even to create an entirely new skill for use in your campaigns. Instead the Prometheus science system provides you with an alternative means of creating flesh golems, one that hews closer to the archetypal images of literature and film.

64529.name: Ancient Engines
64529.description:
From the book's Introduction:

Ancient Engines is the newest Visions sourcebook, inspired by the lack of mighty war machines in d20 fantasy. The new war machines in this sourcebook are to catapults and ballistae what a vorpal sword is to a dagger, and by introducing them into your campaign, you will bring color and a sense of fantastical wonder to your mass battles.

64530.name: The Clockwork Heart
64530.description:
From the book's Introduction:

The Clockwork Heart is a complete adventure for high-level (12-16th) characters. Played to its conclusion, it can form the capstone of a longtime campaign, with the very fate of your campaign world hanging in the balance. If the heroes fail, the consequences aren't just "grab another character sheet and roll up a new character." They are much, much graver than that.

64531.name: Sikestonopoly
64531.description:
Sikestonopoly is a Monopoly-themed board game that was created to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the city of Sikeston, Missouri, which founded in 1860.

The object of the game is to accumulate as much wealth as possible through the purchase, trade, and development of businesses.

Board game spaces include Lambert's Cafe and the Sikeston Jaycees to represent the local rodeo. The Chance cards are called Fate cards in this Monopoly variation and are sponsored by the Kenny Rogers Children's Center.

64532.description: All players are dealt an equal number of tiles. Leftover tiles are out of play. Each player starts with a pawn on Start. Each player, in turn, will draw a tile from the player on the right. If the tile is a number tile, then the drawing player advances that number of spaces on the gameboard. If that tile is an Old Maid tile then that player takes possession of the Old Maid marker. A player may get the Old Maid marker anyway if one lands on an Old Maid space on the gameboard. If a player who is supposed take possession of the Old Maid marker already has it then that player may give the marker away to another player. The first player to reach Finish without having possesssion of the Old Maid marker is the winner.
64532.name: Old Maid: The Board Game

64535.description:
From the back of the box:

The Future of Your Dreams!

Welcome to the 25th Century, a time of super-science and a time of rebellion against the powerful invaders of America. A time of mighty airships armed with deadly disintegrator cannons. A time of valor filled with heroes armed with rocket pistols, jumping belts and good old-fashion courage. A time of danger with shadows filled with black-hearted scourges. A time for a hero like Buck Rogers. And you!

Join Buck and all his friends in the 25th Century with this new adventure game created to thrill, excite, and delight. One player is the Game Master, who controls the adventure, while the other players take on the roles of the heroes in the far-flung, exciting future. Together, they create a continuing game campaign which continues over a number of sessions; the thrill escalates as the players’ heroes become more talented and powerful.

The BUCK ROGERS Adventure Game contains the following:

A 32 page Rule book, which gives the basics of how to be a player and a Game Master in the BUCK ROGERS Adventure Game.
A 32 page World of the 25th Century Book, which describes the classic future world of Buck Rogers, a world of discovery and rebellion.
A 48 page, full color Adventure Book drops your heroes immediately into the thick of things, battling on the side of the American rebels against the evil invaders.
Two full-color, large-scale maps put he 25th Century right on your gaming table.
Loads of stand up counters and tiles put the futuristic action right before your very eyes.
10 six-sided dice, used to determine you character’s fate in the game.
40 Experience Chips let your character mark his or her progress in skill and fame.




It’ all here, complete and contained within this one box; an entire easy-to-learn, adventure extravaganza suitable for would be rocket rangers from age 10 to age 510
64535.name: High Adventure Cliffhangers: The Buck Rogers Adventure Game

64546.name: Voyages of Discovery
64546.description:
From the publishers website:

In a fantasy world not unlike our own, a madman vies for absolute power.

Swept to power during a people's revolution, a soldier has become an Emperor and now all the Continental Kingdoms are within his grasp. Only the naval might of the Island Kingdom and the deadly winter of the Frozen Lands slow his advance but your Queen knows this cannot last and orders every ship she can spare to embark on a Voyage of Discovery.

Unknown islands with resources and magical lore forgotten by men for millennia wait to be discovered. And far to the west there is a New World, which might bring ultimate victory to the Island Kingdom, or sow the seeds of her ultimate destruction.

The wind swells. Your voyage awaits. What direction you sail is up to you.

Voyages of Discovery is a complete fantasy game powered by the Modern20 game engine and set in a sword and sorcery world that technologically resembles 19th century Earth. Voyages of Discovery is a complete setting and game system in one book, nothing else is needed to play.

It contains rules for magic, naval combat, boarding actions and individual adventures.

64547.name: IFGS Fantasy Rules (Revised 6th Edition)
64547.description:
From the back cover of the revised sixth edition:

"The International Fantasy Gaming Society (IFGS) is a non-profit organization created to design and run live-scale, SAFE outdoor fantasy games. Our system includes eight character classes and has mechanisms for fighting (with mock, padded weapons) and for casting spells. This book contains the rules for fantasy games, along with information about how to contact the IFGS and design your own games. We invite you to join us in an exciting organization devoted to fantasy gaming!"

64548.description:
From the publisher: "As adventurers on a photo safari, You'll travel through an exotic rainforest in which surprises and hidden treasures pop up around every turn. Roll the die and move to the space with the matching color along the easy to follow path. Be sure to collect all the puzzle pieces because the first explorer to complete their puzzle is the winner!"

This is part of the "Pop-up Games" line, a series in which the boxes unfold to become gameboards with pop-up scenery.
64548.name: Rainforest Safari

64549.name: Thank God You're Here: The Game
64549.description:
Based on the popular TV show, players will adlib their way through one of seventy different scenes. Scripts supplied will guide the scene through several twists, before the judge's verdict is delivered.

The game includes 5 pieces of wardrobe (medal, nerdy glasses, all-areas pass, microphone, superhero cape), 5 envelopes, 70 scripts, judges pad and pencil.

64554.name: Spellominoes
64554.description:
Make it fun to build words, practice spelling, and expand vocabulary as you play a strategic game of Spellominoes!

The game consists of 40 initial-consonant onset and word ending rhyme cards, 8 blend or digraph onset and rhyme cards, 3 double onset cards, and 3 double rhyme cards. Players start with 3 cards in their hand, but like in dominoes, you may find yourself drawing extra cards from the bone pile.

The winner is the first player to play all of their cards.

64556.name: M.I.G 4
64556.description:
A traditional quiz game in Swedish. M.I.G stands for Mobile Intelligence Games. It is very small and easy to play everywhere. A very good game to bring on a trip.

Two dice are rolled, one to decide category and one to decide if you have a 'M.I.G-chance' and the other decides in what category the question is. If the player didn't roll a 'M.I.G-chance' they have to answer the question correct to have another roll of the dice. If the player has a 'M.I.G-chanse' they have the opportunity to score, either way it's the next players turn.

The first player to correctly answer a 'M.I.G-chance' in each category is the winner.

The questions come in 5 categories:

Now & Then (Nu & då)
Culture & Showbiz (Nöje & kultur)
Home & Away (När & Fjärran)
Sports & All sorts (Sport & blandat)
Nature & Science (Natur & teknik)

The game contains 312 cards with a total of 1560 questions.

64557.name: Dragon (Issue 54 - Oct 1981)
rpgissuearticle: Cavern Quest: A competition module for AD&D play
Down-to-earth divinity: One DM's design for a mixed & matched mythos
The Electric Eye: Computer Technology and Terminology
Larger Than Life: The Righteous Robbers of Liang Shan P'o
These are the Breaks: Weapon damage in AD&D action
64557.description:
Vol. VI No. 4 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Jack Crane.

This issue contained Cavern Quest - A special competition module for AD&D adventuring.

64558.name: Dragon (Issue 56 - Dec 1981)
rpgissuearticle: Eric's dragon won even more treasure
MAD MERC: The Alulu Island Mission
Map hazard, not haphazard: Real topographic maps fill out fantasy worlds
Singing a new tune: A different bard, not quite so hard
The Dragon's Augury:Two mini-winners by Task Force
64558.description:
Vol. VI No. 6 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Phil Foglio.

This issue included MAD MERC: The Alulu Island Mission, A new TOP SECRET® adventure and a section titled Bards: Examining the AD&D character class.

64560.name: Wine Wars
64560.description: Wine Wars -- This fun and fascinating trivia game tests your knowledge of the fruit of the vine. Let the battle begin as players answer questions in categories such as Vine to Vino (growing grapes, making wine, and world production), Wine Cellar (selecting, storing, and tasting wine), and Cork Culture (wine people, business, arts and science, and trivia). Perfect for those new to the world of wine, but challenging enough for the devoted oenophile, Wine Wars will have you swirling, sniffing, and sipping your way to vinicultural victory.

64561.name: Argotics
64561.description:
Argotics is a trivia game about French slang ("argot").
Players roll 1 die to know how many questions will be asked, and another (special) one to know which one of the following category those questions will belong to :
- translations
- language culture
- multiple choice questions
- human relations

They then have the duration of a sand timer to answer the questions and gain one bead for each right answer. The first player to get 7 beads win the game.

64563.name: Oratory
64563.description:
Half-way between checkers and solitaire

The goal of the game is to be the last emperor, i.e. to place a marble in the center spot of the board while your opponent(s) are unable to overthrow you.

Each turn a player can move one of his marbles to either the next spot towards the center of the board or on either side of its current spot. A marble can never be moved backwards (i.e. towards the edge of the board). Marbles are eliminated the same way as in checkers, but can also be blocked in "wells"; the board is rotated under certain circumstances to modify the wells.

Content:

1 game board with perforated rotating disc
36 marbles in 4 colours

64565.name: Vampires (D&D 3.0)
64565.description:
The children of Vangual are coming!

For two thousand years the lords of the night have hidden in shadow.
But all that is about to change.

With amazing powers and abilities, the Lords of the Night have just one thing in mind; the total enslavement of the mortal races.

Setting, Sourcebook, the seeds of an incredible adventure, The Lords of the Night: Vampires is set to shine a light on your favourite denizens of darkness.

Now you can play a vampire in your favourite fantasy setting, or match your wits against the most terrible creatures the Mortal races have ever seen.

Source: Back of Book

user comment
written for d20 System / OGL Product (D&D 3.0 Compatible)
updated for d20 System / OGL Product (D&D 3.5 Compatible) in PDF form Vampires (D&D 3.5)

64567.name: The Compass of Terrestrial Directions, Vol. V: The North
rpgissuearticle: Exalted: The Compass of Terrestrial Directions Volume 5 – The North
64567.description:
Introduction of Book:

Day after day, throughout the winter,
We hardened ourselves to live by bluest reason
In a world of wind and frost.
—Wallace Stevens, "Meditations Celestial & Terrestrial"

Of the five directions of Creation, the North is the coldest and wildest. Every year, frigid winds sweep out from the Elemental Pole of Air to cover the North in ice and snow. Farming is difficult there except along the coasts and in a few sheltered locations, which limits the growth of civilization. Nevertheless, a number of powerful states have grown in the North - and the barbarian tribes who live by hunting and gathering have their own points of interest.

In the Time of Tumult, they all need heroes.

64568.name: Freeport Companion 4e
64568.description:
From the Publisher:

Avast ye scurvy dogs and prepare your game to be boarded by the Freeport Companion compatible with the 4th Edition of Dungeons & Dragons! Complementing the Pirate's Guide to Freeport published by Green Ronin in 2007, this 176 paged tome will make Freeport accessible for 4e campaigns, complete with races, the corsair class, equipment, monsters, an insanity system, magic items and rituals, notable Freeport characters, and an introductory adventure.

64570.description:
1843 aka 18FR-RCE, more familiarly known as 18Fried Rice, is an 18xx re-envisioning of 18FR. Significant differences include a ninth company, an extended train roster, a slew of map changes, an additional private company with a new power and tweaks to the other privates, changes to the track-tile manifest, etc. However this remains a fast train-rush game. Trains are expensive and they move quickly even when player companies aren't buying them...and players will be buying non-permanent trains out of pocket...

The primary goals of 1843 were to reduce the bankruptcy rate to well below 50% of games (versus the near 100% rate of 1830 and 18FR when played aggressively) while also providing for a volatile and dynamic game with good texture and more interesting train and track management sub-games (especially in the late game).

64572.name: Dragon (Issue 60 - Apr 1982)
rpgissuearticle: Alignment: A new view of the nine philosophies
Diarmuid's Last Jest: "He who laughs last..."
Firearms: First guns were not much fun for triggermen or their targets
Flight of the Boodles: A fun game for two humans
Pooka: Time stands still for this critter from Celtic myth
Q: How much do you know about science in a fantasy world?  A: Take this quiz and see!
The Jester: A comical, clever, charsmatic new NPC
64572.description:
Vol. VI No. 10 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Dean Morrissey.

This issue included FLIGHT OF THE BOODLES - A simple game for players who aren’t, the yearly "April Fool's" section, and the third in a series on nonhumans - All about Elves: A Special Section.

64575.name: Monopoly: Bank of America Baseball
64575.description: Monopoly game with Major League Baseball teams as the properties and other baseball related themes for the other board spaces. The game is branded with 'Bank of America'.

64576.name: Dragon (Issue 250 - Aug 1998)
rpgissuearticle: Interfaces: The World of the Mechalus
64576.description:
Dragon, Issue #250
Volume XXIII, No. 3
August 1998

Mark Nelson is the artist that did the cover for this issue, illustrating his vision of an undersea encounter.

64577.name: Looking at Lubbock
rpgseries: A Survivors Guide to Risen America
64577.description:
From the Publisher:

A Survivors Guide to Risen America chronicles the travels of Marion Samuel Lefferts, as he looks for civilisation and other living humans.

Issue 1: LOOKING AT LUBBOCK, follows Marion as he enter Lubbock, encounters more Risers and some less than savoury survivors. This produc includes a full set of 25mm Battletiles

NOTE: AS WITH ALL YEAR OF THE ZOMBIE PRODUCTS THIS IS RATED M FOR MATURE AUDIENCES

64578.name: Searching the City
rpgseries: A Survivors Guide to Risen America
64578.description:
From he Publisher:

A Survivors Guide to Risen America chronicles the travels of Marion Samuel Lefferts, as he looks for civilisation and other living humans.

Issue 2: SEARCHING THE CITY, follows Marion as he delves deeper into Lubbock, encounters a new survivor, and formulates a plan to get to the nearest aid station. This product also contains a detailed deconstructions of the M4 Carbine and SOPMOD Kit.

NOTE: AS WITH ALL YEAR OF THE ZOMBIE PRODUCTS THIS IS RATED M FOR MATURE AUDIENCES

64581.name: Lubbock Grand Prix
rpgseries: A Survivors Guide to Risen America
64581.description:
From the Publisher:

A Survivors Guide to Risen America chronicles the travels of Marion Samuel Lefferts, as he looks for civilisation and other living humans.

Issue 3: LUBBOCK GRANDPRIX, Marion rescues Winter and a small group of survivors. This product also contains the first installment of Survivors Tales and a 25mm battlemap of the aid station..

NOTE: AS WITH ALL YEAR OF THE ZOMBIE PRODUCTS THIS IS RATED M FOR MATURE AUDIENCES

64582.name: Freeze
64582.description:
Abstract strategy board game with only one type of piece.

Number of players: usually 2, one controlling the black pawns, the other controlling the white.
(The instruction booklet also contains rules for a 4 player version.)

The game board is a grid of 144 squares (12 rows x 12 columns). Each square is marked at one of the corners to help identify related squares during a complex move.

The game begins in a unique way:
The players agree on how many pawns each side will have. An empty board is placed between the players and the pawns are placed in front of the players, but not on the board. Black begins by entering one of his pawns on any square except one of the “border squares” (the squares along the edges of the board). Then White enters a pawn, no more than one square away from Black's, and not on a border square. The players continue to take turns, either entering a pawn or moving one that is already on the board.

How the pawns move:
An isolated pawn cannot move – it's frozen (hence the name of the game). A pawn that is not frozen has the potential to make a jumping or non-jumping move in any direction. The jump can be over allied as well as opposing pawns.

When an opponent's pawn is jumped over, it's removed from the board. If the player is not at “stage 2,” that pawn is returned to the opponent to be reentered. If the player has reached stage 2, that pawn is permanently captured.

The last player able to move wins.

The game set has a high quality vinyl roll-up board, 12 black pawns and 12 natural wood colored pawns (molded from material that is 40% recycled wood), and the instruction booklet which includes an explanation of Freeze notation and 12 short sample games, illustrating the rules and touching on the strategy and tactics.

www.frezcogames.com

64583.description:
Description: Those pesky bugs just keep coming at you! Your job is to SWAT them right when they score the most points. But be quick or your fellow players will SWAT them first.

SWAT! is about capturing cards. A dealer turns over cards one-by-one, until someone decides he wants the exposed cards and hits the colorful "SWAT!" board. That player then becomes the dealer and the same process continues until all players have "swatted" three times or the deck runs out. Your challenge is to remember what you have already swatted and decide how far you can push your luck before another player swats the stack. The artwork is fun, imaginative and might get a little bit under your skin!
64583.name: SWAT!

64584.name: Voice of Doom
64584.description:
From the back of the book:

Flash! In a news conference this afternoon, American Eagle, leader of the Freedom Squad, issued a nationwide appeal for assistance in the Squad's investigation of the wave of terrorist attacks on its members.

Meet the Freedom Squad, as nice a band of superheroes as you'd ever want to meet. They're friendly, brave, and dedicated. They're also dying! Someone has marked the Freedom Squad for death; half of them have fallen already. They need help. Your help! Now they've put out a call for aid in their hour of need. They want tough, experienced heroes who will help them face their unknown adversaries. Do you qualify?

Join the 3 remaining Freedom Squaders as they unravel the myster of VOICE, meet awesome opponents, and prove once again what it takes to be a real hero!

This adventure is intended for veteran CHAMPIONS players. VOICE OF DOOM includes an action-packed adventure scenario, complete descriptions on the members of a valiant (if somewhat overwhelmed) super group, and as evil an organization of killers as you'll find anywhere!

64585.name: Scourge from the Deep
64585.description:
From the back cover:

Tired of your typical train-throwing, city-smashing, superhero showdown? Had enough airborn autos and falling buildings to make you want to hang up the ol' super cape? Well, leave DC, NY, and LA behind. . . and plunge into the depths of aquatic action!

That's right - superheroes are taking to the water!

Scourge from the Deep overflows with rules for practically every aspect of underwater gaming: skills, powers, special effects, gadgets, and hazards. This Hero supplement also offers a complete below the waves adventure that will toss your heroes about with ten of the most vengeful villains you will find on any part of the planet. Detailed descriptions of three salty organizations spice up this already hot supplement.

So hold your breath, dive into the big blue, and take on some real slime balls as you become entangled in a turbulent criminal plot.

What's the matter - afraid of the water? Last one in is a rotten hero.

64586.name: Red Doom
64586.description:
From the back cover:

RED ALERT! RED ALERT!

The Russians are here!

Two titanic teams of Communist Champions are ready to take on all comers! These refugees and patriots, criminals and killers are out to make the world safe for Marxism. They are as powerful as the motherland and as current as today's headlines. Only your heroes can stand against them. Will you face down the Soviets without blowing up the world?

Red Doom is an organization supplement for Champions. It details the Supreme Soviets and the Comintern, the official hero-teams of the Soviet Union and the Warsaw Pact, respectively. The supplement also includes descriptions of nine other Soviet Supers like Bolshevik Barracuda and General Mayhem. Six commie-stomping adventures can easily be inserted into any campaign.

These dedicated villains wander the world pursuing anything that might give the Soviet Union or Eastern Europe an advantage - technological, intellectual, moral, magical - whatever. Protect freedom and democracy once and for all. Just say Nyet to the Supremem Soviets.

64588.name: Atlas Unleashed
64588.description:
From the back cover:

Supervillain terrorist. The very term is enough to make the toughtest lawman cringe. Atlas is a worldwide terroist conspiracy dedicated to bringing the superpowers to their knees. They are are well-financed and armed with the latest in high-tech weaponry and equipment. Performing genetic experiments, these masterminds have createad a monstrous breed of super-villains. When Atlas commands them to activate a nuclear bomb over a peaceful city, it's time for your superheroes to act. Do you have the power and the determination to stop Atlas before it is too late?

64590.name: Escape from Castle Quarras
64590.description:
Super Endless Quest Adventure Gamebook #3

From Back Cover:

Now you can experience all the thrills of playing the ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game by yourself-- in book form!

ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Adventure Gamebooks use a simple, unique role-playing game system based on the popular ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game, incorporating two standard six-sided dice, hit points, skill points, experience points, and much more.

In Escape from Castle Quarras, you, and only you, can release the kingdom of Quarras from the evil influence of the vile sorcerer Kharseron and the magical gem of Illystia, which holds the kingdom in thrall.

ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Adventure Gamebooks read like books, play like games, and offer a thrill a minute-- with YOU as the hero!

34 possible endings.

64591.description:
The first course was included in Ludodélire's french version of Formule Dé. For other countries, he was sold standalone too.

38" x 24"; 167 spaces long; 10 corners (one "3", two "2"); straights 28, 23, 18; longest straight starts from "3".

PLUE : 1 A 7 VARIABLE : 8 A 12 SOLEIL : 13 A 20
64591.name: Formule Dé Circuit № 1: Grand Prix de MONACO

64592.description:
This unoffical print & play expansion replaces the game board from Small World with a randomly generated map every time you play. This provides greater variation in how the various race/power combinations are valued, and results in a wider variety of tactical choices and overall deeper gameplay.

The updated expansion includes rules and components for increasing the maximum number of players from 5 to 6, plus a number of special map templates/scenarios for more varied gameplay.

Much of the artwork in this expansion is copyright, and used with permission from Days of Wonder, Inc., for non-commercial purposes only.
64592.name: Random Map Expansion (fan expansion for Small World)

64593.name: Medina de Rio Seco
64593.description:
Simple board wargame on the July 14, 1808 Peninsular War battle between a French corps commanded by Bessières and the Army of Galicia under the joint command of Blake and La Cuesta.

Published in Casus Belli (Issue 19 - Feb 1984) magazine.

1 map sheet, 17x26 hexes map + charts
60 unmounted counters
rules

Sequence of Play:
- French Movement
- French Combat
- Spanish Movement
- Spanish Combat
- Reorganization

Rules Notes:
- 1 historical and 1 hypothetical scenario
- 8 turns
- Locking Active Zones of Control
- units check for possible disorganization (die roll) after each retreat
- leaders, lines of communication

64594.name: Instant Action! Quick Play Rules
64594.description:
User summary

This is a 1-page quick-start summary of the Action! System rules.

It covers:


Attributes
Skills & skill checks
Combat

64595.name: Active Exploits
64595.description:
User summary

This is the first edition of the Active Exploits rulebook. The very first pre-release edition was called "Action Exploits", but this name was changed later to "Active Exploits"

This book contains rules for:


Abilities and Skills
Task resolution
Special abilities (magic, super powers, etc.)
Character gimmicks
Character convictions
Combat
Character sheet

64596.name: Exit Music
64596.description:
User summary

Exit Music is a free contemporary horror adventure for Active Exploits, Impresa, and Ghostories.

The characters are trapped in a telepathic dream of an unborn child after they witnessed a car accident.

64597.name: Villin Lännen Poppamies
64597.description:
Villin Lännen Poppamies (Finnish for "The Medicine Man of the Wild West") is played on a map of North America. It is similar to the classic Finnish game "Afrikan Tähti" but here the objective is to find the token for the Medicine Man on the map and deliver him back to Washington (from where all players start) to win the game.

The players travel on the roads/waterways between cities where they flip tokens to reveal indians or military/settlers. The game uses rifles as its currency, to protect the players from hostile indian tokens flipped over or to pay tolls for crossing borders or using waterways.

64598.name: The Kingdom of Norweign
rpgissuearticle: Nuts & Bolts of Active Exploits Diceless
64598.description:
User summary

The Kingdom of Norweign is the only book in the Ravaged Europe Series, a campaign setting for Active Exploits set in a dark fantasy version of medieval Europe.

The book gives a short overview of Ravaged Europe, and of the region called The Norweign, which encompasses the equivalent of the British Isles, Scandinavia and Denmark.

The Kingdom of Norweign offers new character options like Aptitudes and Gimmicks and presents some character templates.

64599.name: The Shaded Veil
rpgissuearticle: Nuts & Bolts of Active Exploits Diceless
64599.description:
User summary

The Shaded Veil is a horror campaign setting for Active Exploits. The basic premise is that the Shaded Veil is an imperfect barrier that shields our world from the Asral Realm. Sometimes, horrors from the Astral Realm slip through the Veil. These include ghosts, vampires and werewolves, among others.

The book gives some background information, like when and where the Veil becomes especially thin and describes the horrors from beyong the Veil. It also adds sanity rules, new character options, relics, and character templates.

64600.name: Dark Sun Campaign Setting
rpghonor: 2011 ENnie for Best Setting - Silver Winner
2011 ENnies for Best Art, Interior - Nominee
64600.description:
From the publisher's website description:

Explore a savage, wondrous world.

Aimed at players and Dungeon Masters, this game supplement explores the heroes and wonders of Athas - a savage desert world abandoned by the gods and ruled by terrible sorcerer-kings. Use it to build Dark Sun heroes and thrilling D&D adventures set in the Seven Cities of the Tyr Region, the Ivory Triangle, the Sea of Silt, and monster-infested wastelands - or plunder it for your own D&D campaign!

The Dark Sun Campaign Setting provides exciting character options for D&D players, including new races, new character themes and class builds, new paragon paths and epic destinies, and new equipment. It also provides everything Dungeon Masters need to run 4th Edition Dark Sun campaigns or include Dark Sun elements in their homebrew campaigns. It has rules and advice for handling survival challenges, arena encounters, desert terrain, and adventure creation. It also presents a short, ready-to-play introductory adventure.
rpgpodcastepisode: Acquisitions Incorporated - Expedition in Dark Sun (Part 1)
Acquisitions Incorporated - Expedition in Dark Sun (Part 2)
Acquisitions Incorporated - Expedition in Dark Sun (Part 3)
Acquisitions Incorporated - Expedition in Dark Sun (Part 4)
Acquisitions Incorporated - Expedition in Dark Sun (Part 5)
Acquisitions Incorporated - Expedition in Dark Sun (Part 6)
Acquisitions Incorporated - Expedition in Dark Sun (Part 7)
Dark Sun Episode 03: Dark Come Soon
Dark Sun Episode 1 – Rime of the Cursed Artifact
Dark Sun Episode 2: Welcome to Urik
DND XP 2010: Athas Unveiled: Dark Sun Returns

64601.name: Dark Sun Creature Catalog
rpgpodcastepisode: DND XP 2010: Athas Unveiled: Dark Sun Returns
64601.description:
From the publisher's website:

Monsters and other threats from the world of Athas.

This supplement for the Dark Sun Campaign Setting collects the most iconic and dangerous monsters of the Dark Sun campaign setting into one handy tome. It also contains other hazards and threats found in the desert wastelands and dungeon tombs of Athas. The creatures and threats presented herein make worthy encounters for Athasian heroes or the heroes in your "homebrew" D&D campaign.

64602.name: Impresa Express Rules
64602.description:
User summary

The Impresa Express Rules contain the basic rules system. This includes character creation, task resolution, combat, and a rudimentary magic/super powers system based on the abilities and skills rules.

The file contains conversion rules to Active Exploits and [1166]. It is released under its own license, the "Impresa Express Open Collaborative License v1.0".

64603.description:
Vicky the Viking based boardgame in which the players try to obtain diamonds. There are several phases in which the players place one of their hand cards on a personal board, then all cards in that particular position are compared and the winner gets a diamond (bounty depends on the position of the card on the board, winning depends on different symbols on the cards).
Defeated cards are always discarded, victorious cards stay on the board until defeated. When the first player has collected seven diamonds, he/she is the winner.
64603.name: Diamantenraub

64604.description:
From the Web site:

The second volume in the Hammer's Slammers game system is here! Hammer's Anvils contains rule enhancements to the basic system in Handbook 1, and optional rules like:

Separate Detachments (for multi-detachment forces);
The Whites of Their Eyes (range bands);
The Big Guns (on- and off-table artillery);
Mounting Chaos (loss of TU's and what it does to leadership);
Overkill (why big guns do more damage);
Courage Under Fire (varying suppression on infantry, based on quality); and
A Leader of Men (using leadership to remove suppression).

Included are rules for: Mortars and MLRS systems, mines and countermeasures, spotting with snipers, top and bottom vehicle defensive arcs, and what happens if an APC "brews up," plus enhanced weapon charts, Tactical Unit Points Costs, and examples of platoon sized detachments.

Finally, there are two appendices (names and numbers of Slammers vehicles and a Time-line for the Slammers universe) plus 10 pages of descriptions of the colour plates, and errata for the first volume.

From the Web site:

Hammer's Anvils is an expansion for the Hammer's Slammers Handbook, containing new optional rules and detailed organisations for other forces, such as Broglie's Legion, The Thunderbolt Division, The Zaporoskiye Brigade, and the Compagnie de Barthe, with vehicle types and development, organisational strengths, and so on.

Background info on other units includes: Heliodorus Regiment, The Wolverines, Harris' Commandos, The Firelords, West Riding Yeomanry, Anders' Legion, The Apex Dragoons, The Sons of Mangala, Flaming Sword Commando of the Holy Brotherhood, United Defence Batteries, Foster's Mercenaries, Fasolini's Company, Division Légere, Lightning Division, The Waldheim Dragoons, Texian 101st Airborne Light Infantry, Solace & Prosperity Regulars, Nonesuch National Guard, Hindi Army, Oltenian Republican Army, Hashemite Nation, Terran Authority Starmarines, and the Sincanmo Federation Militia with illustrations of unit insignia.

In all, there are approximately 160 illustrations and photos in colour and mono.
64604.name: Hammer's Anvils

64605.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Are you a hero?

Battlestations is a character-based adventure game of simultaneous ship-to-ship and boarding combat in space. Players work together against the forces controlled by the referee. Battlestations can be played as one-off missions or as part of an ongoing campaign. You'll track character's positions on the spaceship layouts and the ships' positions on the hex map. The action in Battlestations is literally character driven. If you want the ship to turn or speed up, a character has to take an action to make is so. If you want the ship's guns to fire at an enemy ship, a character has to take an action to fire the guns.

This is the rulebook only. You will need the full boxed game to play.
64605.name: Battlestations Core Rulebook

64606.name: Outpost Qether (d20)
rpghonor: 2001 ENnie for Best Free Product - Nominee
64606.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"...Qether rests on the western edge of what the Arak call the Ter'savan'filin which, roughly translated, means "The Wood of the Outdwellers." It is assumed that by 'Outdwellers', the Arak mean the other races; but in truth no one has ever thought to ask. The area is narrow strip of meadow and plain that is bounded on the south by the Highmoor hills. These hills are an odd mix of hill and lowland, so that the hills are rocky and are covered by various vines and moss-like plants, and the hollows are little better that midge-infested swamp. There are tales that the Zeredites used the hills for unnatural magical rituals, and that, somewhere, buried beneath one of the rounded hills, there is an abandoned Black Temple. Such tales are generally reserved for children who will not obey their parents, or foolish adventurers who set out from Erech with gold in their eyes and return weary, beaten, and disillusioned..."

-- from Outpost Qether

Outpost Qether is a settting guide to the westernmost Tirasim frontier. The outpost is home to all sorts; traders, criminals, and military men. It is a place where hope is fading fast, for the Judges in Arioch have decided that the fifty-year-old installation has outlived its usefulness. Unless someone finds a good reason for the outpost to remain, it will be shut down.

Recently, however, local scouts has returned with news...the Gadianti have set up a small post and are digging for...something. Perhaps it might just be the thing to give the outpost reason to exist. Perhaps if they send a party of adventurers to find out what's going on over there...

What's inside?
Within Outpost Qether's 28 pages, you'll find...

A complete guide to the people and places in and around the outpost,
A short adventure, where the party is sent to investigate the Gadianti actions on the coast,
An appendix listing all the monsters from WoTC's Monster Manual that exist on Diomin, and how they came to be.

64607.name: Adventures in Delving
64607.description:
User summary

The adventures in Delving rulebook contains:


Character creation rules
Task resolution
Combat rules
Treasures
a bestiary

64608.name: Kapitan Bomba
64608.description:
Kapitan Bomba is a 2-player card game published by Kuźnia Gier. It was based upon a popular Polsih cartoon under the same title, from GIT Produkcja, broadcast by 4fun.tv.

One player as Kapitan Bomba (Captain Bomb) defends the Kurvix Galaxy from evil Sułtan Kosmitów (Alien Sultan) controlled by the other player. The objective of the game is different for each player. Sułtan Kosmitów must gain control of 5 planets, Kapitan Bomba has to kill any 11 aliens or 8 of different types.

The humor in he game is based on vulgarities and obscene drawings, mainly concerning sex, so it is unsuitable for people under 18. The setting is futuristic science-fiction.

The game contains the following components:

- two decks of 55 cards
- the rulebook

64609.name: Adventures in Science!
64609.description:
User summary

The Adventures in Science! rulebook contains:


A bit of pulp-era background
Character creation rules
Task resolution
Combat rules
Rules for creaing gadgets
Adversaries

64610.name: Star Wars R2-D2 is in Trouble
64610.description:
Help Anakin Skywalker and C-3PO race around the chamber to save R2-D2 from the force field! Give the bubble a pop to get Artoo on his feet! With Artoo's help, you can fly around the board at galactic speed, bring out another pawn to help you, or bump one of your opponents' back before they do it to you! Be the first member of the Republic to get all four of your players to the finish area - and you win!

DIFFERENCE FROM CLASSIC TROUBLE: The dice bubble contains a small figure of R2-D2 which acts as an extra dice with a value of "6" if Artoo is standing after the "roll". This can be used in conjunction with the regular die in the bubble.

64611.name: Monopoly Get Out of Jail Mini Game
64611.description:
Contents:
Jail base and 4 jail walls
24 prisoners (3 of each in 8 different colors)
6 prison guards
1 spade

Prisoners and guards are placed in the jail cell and in turn, each player manipulates the spade underneath the cell and through slats in the floor of the cell in an attempt to flick out prisoners of different colors. Don't free a prison guard, or you're busted!
This game has a push-your luck component (players may stop flicking at any time and keep their freed prisoners, but if a prison guard is flicked out, all freed prisoners are returned and that player's turn is over) and a set collection mechanic (collect 3 prisoners of any individual color for double points).

This game can be played as a stand-alone game, or can be combined with any Monopoly game as an alternative to rolling doubles to get out of jail.

64612.name: Last Train Out of Warsaw
rpghonor: 2009 Indie RPG Awards - Best Free Game - Runner Up
64612.description:
Last Train Out Of Warsaw is a short, focused roleplaying game using Matthijs Holter's Archipelago II as a rules engine.


Set on the eve of the German encirclement of Warsaw in 1939, this game casts players in the roles of some of the passengers on the very last train out of that doomed city. Play progresses through a fixed series of scenes as the train flees the horrors of war towards safety in Romania. The train journey is fraught with incidents both external - a German air attack, a bandit raid, a station full of Poles desperate to get on the train - and internal - each passenger has issues and secrets that will be revealed through play and which may quite literally derail the escape.


The full text of the game, in PDF format, is currently freely downloadable from lulu.

64614.name: Warships
64614.description:
User summary

Warships is a free Alternity supplement that replaces much of the previously released material on starship construction and combat. It was released by Wizards of the Coast after cancelling the Alternity line.

The book contains:

Basic spaceship combat
Advanced combat rules
Narrative combat rules
Three-dimensional combat
Ship construction rules
Stations and Bases
Space combat hex maps

64615.name: FISH ON
64615.description: The game is fun for the entire family. Object of the game is to score the most "braggin' rights" which are similar to points. Each game piece is your boat, and the path of the game takes your around the lake. Starting at the cabin, you roll the dice. If you land on a "Fish On!" space, you select a lure and start fishing. Depending on the size and species of fish, you collect the "braggin' rights". Other spaces include a "Fishing Duel", where the player chooses another player to a duel, the biggest fish wins. Look out, not all the spaces are rewarding! The player who finishes the day with the most "braggin' rights" wins.

64617.name: The Penguin Game
64617.description:
The little penguins are striving to stay atop a melting iceberg. Unfortunately the body heat of the penguins is melting the ice. Who can stay afloat the longest?
Each player will take on the role of a penguin. On your turn, you will make a move, then remove (or melt) the spot that you left. If you can't make a legal move then you're out of the game. Last player on the iceberg wins!

64618.name: The Trouble with Drazi
64618.description:
From the back of the book


The Drazi. For millennia they have fought... and fought.


After being rescued from a crippled ship, a group of strangers is thrust into the middle of this simmering hotbed of violence, and given a front row seat for a Drazi power play and a chance to observe some of the race's best and worst qualities. A case of mistaken identity leads to danger and adventure on the Drazi planet of Fendamir, assassins lurk around every corner and death awaits in the shadows as these strangers are forced to rely on their wits and brawn to survive on a planet where martial prowess is a way of life.

The Trouble with Drazi is a start up adventure using the Traveller system. You will require the Traveller rulebook and The Universe of Babylon 5 to play this adventure.

64619.name: Ett frågespel från SCB
64619.description:
Promotional trivia game from the Swedish bureau of statistics. The game features a simple push your luck mechanic: two teams take turns to answer questions and can stop at 1 point for one correct answer or attempt to gain 3 points by answering two questions in succession.

The pack of cards in the 2009 edition includes around 100 questions related to Swedish statistics in the years 2006-2008, e.g. "How many babies were born in 2007 on the day of that year when the least number of babies were born?" Unlike the typical trivia game, answers are accompanied by additional related trivia or historical comparisons.

Later editions seem to have dropped the rules, leaving the "game" as just a deck of questions, and have fewer notes to accompany the answers.

64620.name: Warships of Babylon 5
64620.description:
From the back of the book

From the humble Hermes to the mighty Victory-class advanced destroyer, this book features many of the ships found in the Babylon 5 universe, provides all the rules you need to use them in Traveller and features extensive deck plans for them! Whether you need a small frigate for players to crew or a terrifying Sharlin warcruiser for them to escape from, everything you need to ply the space lanes of the Babylon 5 universe can be found here.

Inside this book you will find:


Earth Alliance: Hermes, Hyperion, Nova, Omega, Warlock.
Minbari Federation: Combat Flyer, Sharlin, Tigara, Torotha.
Centauri Republic: Demos, Primus, Senti, Vorchan.
Narn Regime: Dag'Kar, G'Quan, Sho'Kos, T'Loth.
League of Non-Aligned Worlds: Avioki, Bimith, Sky Serpent, Warbird, Xill, Drahk Light Raider, Raider Delta-V, Shadow Cruiser, Shadow Fighter, Vorion Transport.

64621.name: The Rifter (Issue 31 - Aug 2005)
rpgissuearticle: From the Desk of Kevin Siembieda
A Shadow of the Past - The Quest for Castlerake
64621.description:
From the Publisher

Issue number 31 presents optional rules, a new O.C.C., new weapons, monsters and robots, and adventure galore. Plus the latest on the hotly anticipated new edition of Rifts and other product information and news. unleash your imagination.

* Heroes Unlimited - Aliens, montsers, and adventure.
* Palladium Fantasy RPG - Epic adventure in the Quest for Castlerake.
* Rifts - Triax & the NGR adventure, intrigue and weapons.
* Rifts Phase World - Sunhammer; source material and adventure ideas.
* Phase World fiction: The Hammer of the Forge.
* News and happenings.
* Convention schedule, coming attractions and more.
* 96 pages of fun and ideas!

64622.name: Deconstruction of Falling Stars
64622.description:
User summary

Deconstruction of Falling Stars is a compilation of official Babylon 5 material that did not see publication in any other Babylon 5 product. It is was published shortly before the expiration of Mongoose's license for Babylon 5.

Contents:


Everyday Life in 2258
Plots and Plot Ideas
Getting Around the Man (Security Forces)
Dust (Essay on the drug Dust)
Travelling Through Hyperspace
Ranks and Awards in Babylon 5
Creatures of the Galaxy
Interplanetary Expeditions
Names
Interstellar Network News
Whispers in Darkness (7-page adventure)
Ancient Echoes (46-page adventure)
Blood Dimmed Tide (23-page adventure)
Into the Crucible (106-page adventure)
Dilgar (168-page sourcebook on the Dilgar race)
Baptism of Fire (92-page novel)
Ranger Dawning (75-page novel)
Visions of Peace (80-page novel)

64624.name: Ship Plans Volume II - G'Quan
64624.description:
From the back of the book

This latest product in the new Ship Plans range for the B5 universe is a complete tour of one of the Narn Regime's finest warships: The magnificent G'Quan-class heavy cruiser, in all its glory. The G'Quan forms the core of any Narn attack fleet. With the development of the G'Quan, the Narn finally threw off their dependence upon old Centauri technology and implemented revolutionary design features.

G'Quan Ship Plans takes you through every aspect of this workhorse of the Narn Regime fleet - every bulkhead, generator, capability and design flaw. Painstakingly researched from both the B6 canon universe and real-life naval and space vessels, every deck on the ship has a full, detailed and to-scale schematic, along with accompanying descriptions and explanations.

user comment
the print edition contains a booklet, a folded map of the deck plans and a cardboard "screen" with a map of the ship.

64625.name: Heroes & Aliens
64625.description:
From the back of the book

As the saga of Babylon 5 developed over the years so its crew and passengers grew, gaining in skill and cunning, as their heroic deeds and clandestine plots unravelled in the deeps of space. Heroes & Aliens presents each of the major (and some of the minor) characters in the series, giving a complete list of their statistics, fully updated for Babylon 5 Roleplaying Game 2nd Edition, and showing how they developed over the years. With this book you can include any character from the series from any period in your own games. Sheridan, G'Kar, Londo and all the major characters are detailed, along with Morden, Byron and even the crew of the Excalibur.

Along with a comprehensive list of characters, Heroes & Aliens also includes complete details for two updated prestige classes: the Master of Subtlety and the Xenobiologist.

Finally, details of fifteen races are presented, from the Cascor to the Zanderians, giving players a huge choice when creating their Babylon 5 characters. Some of these races, like the Gaim and the Llort are can be regularly seen wandering the corridors of Babylon 5 whilst others, like the Hurr and Dilgar, are very rare indeed.

Heroes & Aliens is intended for Players and Game Masters alike.

64626.name: Vampire: The Requiem Character Sheet Pad
64626.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Keeping Track

The danse macabre is set to the tune of secrets. Who knows them, who keeps them and who's willing to share - for a price. Now you have a place to keep all of your Vampire character's secrets. Just beware the player looking over your shoulder.

No More Photocopies

Continuing its line of tools for the Storytelling System, White Wolf provides this indispensable collection of pre-printed Vampire: The Requiem character sheets. Each pad contains all 25 combinations of Clan and Covenant variations.

64627.description: Chester Gump Game Another simple roll and move game from the series of Milton Bradley games based on the comic strip character of the times.
64627.name: Chester Gump Game

64628.description:
Chester Gump Game, In the City of Gold
Another simple roll and move game from the Milton Bradley series of games based on the comic strip character of the times.
64628.name: Chester Gump Game, In The City Of Gold

64629.name: Werewolf: The Forsaken Character Sheet Pad
64629.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Know Your Tribe

Descended from Luna and Father Wolf, werewolves are the heirs of a mythic and glorious heritage. Or, they would be if not for their grievous ancestral crime against nature itself. How does the shame of being forsaken stain your character’s soul - and character sheet?

Make your Mark

Continuing its line of tools for the Storytelling System, White Wolf provides this indispensable collection of pre-printed Werewolf: The Forsaken character sheets. Each pad contains a character sheet for each of the six Tribe and Auspice combinations..

64630.description: Skeezix and the Air Mail A simple roll and move game from the Milton Bradley series of games based on the comic strip character of the times. This game is circa 1930's
64630.name: Skeezix and the Air Mail

64633.name: Spanky Spanky: The Hanky Panky Game
64633.description:
This is an ADULT party game with strong sexual content.

Players represent students at the Academy of Sweet Suffering (A.S.S.) and must attempt to move up the academic ladder to graduate... hopefully while receiving just a few spankings.

Each pupil starts the game in the locker room and advances along the path on the game board by answering questions correctly. Wrong answers result in the student getting a "black mark" score chip and three chips equals a spanking. The contestants take turns serving as the "Spankmaster General" to administer the punishments.

Various event cards guide the flow of the game, including domination and submission cards. The first player to travel up the ladder three times is declared the winner.

Includes board, cards, die, rules, scoring tokens, and a toy whip with a feather tickler!

Designed for 2 to 8 players or 2 to 4 teams.

64634.name: Mage: The Awakening Character Sheet Pad
64634.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Sheet for Everything

The Awakened struggle to rebuild their societies and carve out their own kingdoms on Earth. Witch, technomancer, shaman - which one are you?

A Play Aid for Mage: The Awakening

- Preprinted character sheets, customized for every playable path and order.
- Easy to photocopy or use as is - no need to photocopy your rulebook.
- Every player needs a sheet, making this a valuable play aid.

64635.name: Atlantis
64635.description:
From the back of the book:

Dive into adventure. Atlantis, the complete sourcebook of the undersea kingdom. The legendary realm of Atlantis comes to life in this amazing sourcebook. The Atlantis sourcebook is packed with history, background, and story possibilities. You'll find complete backgrounds, descriptions and writeups of major Atlantean characters, creatures of the sea, spells, equipment, and much more. You can even create your own Atlantean characters! The story possibilities are endless; you'll add a new dimension to your Champions campaign with Atlantis!

Atlantis provides a wealth of background and information for players and GMs alike. Inside you'll find:

- New rules for underwater adventuring
- 18 characters
- Vehicles and equipment
- A complete superhero adventure and seven adventure seeds
- New martial art and racial package deals for Atlanteans
- 10 undersea creatures
- 18 spells of mighty Atlantean magic
- And more!

64637.name: The Olympians
64637.description:
From the back cover:

The Olympians. Remembert Zeus, Hera, Athena, Apollo, Poseidon, Dionysus - the Gods of Classical Greece, the ancient deities who inspired men to heroic deeds?

They're Back

The second war against the Titans was long and difficult. When the gods had finally won, Zeus decided to re-open the portal to Earth. But instead of ancient Classical Greece, the Greek gods emerged into 20th century Earth.

Some are taking to it better than others. Stunning Aphrodite has joined the rands of super models, and Hermes is doing PR for an overnight courier. Zeus, however, is unhappy at the changes that have occured since he left Earth. And in the depths of Tartarus, Cronus and the other Titans plot their revenge.

Is mankind ready for the second arrival of The Olympians?

The Olympians Contains:
- Full write-ups for the principle Greek gods, including details on their current activities. Hunt with Artemis, or party with Dionysus! There are also statistics for prominent monsters from Greek myth, including the Cyclops, the Nereids, and the Furies.
- Guidelines for creating additional Greek gods, including gods as Player Characters.
- Full details and layouts for interesting Greek locations, including Olympus and Tartarus, the Land of the Dead.
- Campaign guidelines for using the Greek gods in a Champions campaign.
- Scenarios.

64638.name: Wealth of Nations Super Industry Tiles
64638.description:
Every nation has to innovate to compete. Be that nation with these new Super Industry Tiles.

The second official expansion to Wealth of Nations. The Super Industry Tiles allow you to play in new and creative ways. This mini-expansion contains the Super Industry Tiles rules and 3 new tiles including:

Integrated Economy Tile - This tile is combines farms and generators together on one tile. It allows for new side by side development of these blocs.

Financial Center Tile - The new center of a mega bank bloc that allows for 5 bank tiles to be played together. This completed mega Bank bloc can produce $180 per turn!

War Economy Tile - The clouds of war demand additional Energy and Labor and the War Economy Tile allows you to produce more of both. It combines academies and generators together on one tile.

64639.name: Dragon (Issue 62 - Jun 1982)
rpgissuearticle: From The Sorceror's Scroll: Everything You Never Knew About Spell Books
GANGBUSTERS! Designer's Notes: The 1920s Come Alive in TSR's New RPG
Half-Orcs: They're rude and crude, and so's their point of view
Leomund's Tiny Hut: Magic for merchants
Pages from the Mages: A quartet of long-lost magical manuals
The Gods of the Orcs: The word from above: make war not love
Zadron's Pouch of Wonders: You don't know what you'll get until what you've got is gone
64639.description:
Vol. VI No. 12 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Larry Elmore.

This issue contained Chinatown: The Jaded Temple - An adventure for TOP SECRET® agents, our annual full-blown dragon section, and the fifth in a series on nonhumans - Half-orcs - They’re rude and crude.

64641.name: Cthulhu Now (1987 Edition)
rpgissuearticle: The Way of the Exploding Gun
64641.description:
From the back cover:

Cthulhu Now
Modern Background and Adventures For Call of Cthulhu Roleplaying

Cthulhu and the Old Ones remain powerful in the half-century since Lovecraft's death. The globe is well-explored, but the darkness within men's souls is unfathomed. Now human fortunes encompass Cthulhu and the H-Bomb too! Does technology aid the struggle for good, or is it helpless against forces from beyond space, beyond time?

Cthulhu Now includes four roleplaying adventures, "The City in the Sea," "The Killer Out of Space," "The Evil Stars," and "Dreams Dark and Deadly." Background essays provide new skills and occupations, up-to-date cash-flow information, an elaborate firearms article (and a foldout illustrating contemporary firearms), active and passive night-vision equipment, a survey of forensic pathology from Sherlock Holmes' day to the present (required reading for every serieous player), and even a hit location option (useful when lots of bullets must be dealt with). Player aids for the adventures are repeated on perforated pages at the back of the book.

64643.name: Dragon (Issue 63 - Jul 1982)
rpgissuearticle: Bandits! A shifty character for your campaigns
...but not least: The Humanoids - Goals and gods of the kobolds, goblins, hobgoblins & gnolls
Computer Games Have a Way To Go
The Electric Eye: Computer Technology and Terminology
Featured Creatures: Official AD&D Monsters for Your Campaign
For the sake of change: Coins through the ages
From the Sorceror's Scroll: The big, bad barbarian
Games Fair 82: Everything convention-goers could ask
Greyhawk's World: News, notes and views of the Greyhawk campaign
Leomund's Tiny Hut: Make charisma count for more
Plan before you play: Think it over, then map it out
Two UK fanzines are jolly good gaming journals
64643.description:
Vol. VII No. 1 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by James Warhola.

This issue contained CHAGMAT - An AD&D adventure by Larry DiTillio.

64644.name: The Dungeoneer Journal #23
rpgissuearticle: An Interview with M. A. R. Barker
64644.description:
The Dungeoneer Journal
Issue #23
October/November 1980

Cover art by Paul Jaquays.

64645.name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 19 - Feb/Mar 1980)
rpgissuearticle: Who Cares If Magic-Users Are Equal To Fighters?
64645.description:
Contents:

A Melee System
Martial Artists Errata
Class Consciousness
Witches
Doors
Who Cares if Magic-Users Are Equal to Fighters?
An Adjusted Dexterity Table
A New Wargames Rating System
The Dungeon Vlademor
Lord Foul's Demondim Spawn
Poisons - Types and Reactions
Falling Accidents
Beating, Bashing, and General Mugging
Estimating Power
Players' and Judge's Flowcharts
Omniscient Opinions
Prodigious Platemail
Tips From the Tower
Conventionwatch
The Die is Cast: Review - Star Trek the Movie
Dungeon Dilemma

64646.name: Holy Lands: The Dark Ages (Boxed Set)
64646.description:
From the Box

Holy Lands, The Christian Role-Playing Game

A role-playing game for the true hero! Welcome to the art of role-playing! Here, you can become a knight, a saint, or any other character seeking treasure and adventure in the limitless medieval world!

IMAGINE THIS:

You and your traveling companion, Brother Marcus, have entered a dark, underground cave in search of holy relics. You haven't seen anything but the narrow walls of the cave for hours. You are afraid that the caves are empty and worse than that, you're lost! Just then, you see a shimmer of gold up ahead flash from the flicker of torch fire. You and Marcus step forward somewhat slower than before. Soon, you both see a beautiful golden sword, once belonging to the Knights of the Cross, just hanging on the cave wall waiting for you to grab it! You think, this seems too easy, but the power and beauty of the fabled relic is very compelling. Just then, Brother Marcus, overtaken with greed, rushes for the sword. But before he takes a second step, you grab his cloak and stop him dead in his tracks. With your staff, you strike the ground to find the entire floor between you and the sword swing open, revealing what could have been a fatal fall.

What will you do next? Are you ready? Find out in this exciting game of adventure!

User Summary

The boxed set of Holy Lands - The Dark Ages contains the following items:


Game Manual (ie Rulebook)
A Dice Bag and a set of Polyhedral Dice (this came in two versions: 1. a red bag with red dice, & 2. a violet bag with violet/blue dice)
Pencils (stamped with the game's name)
Maps (inside the rulebook)
An Adventure (inside the rulebook)
Character sheets (on parchment style paper)


Original MSRP $23.95

64648.description:
Pictureka! rolls into 9 changeable cubes and 3 great games! The find it fast, find it first cube game!

Contents include 18 interchangeable cube halves (9 blue, 9 white), 1 game grid, 40 cards and instructions.

Each mission card tells you what to look for on the cubes.
Game 1: Split up the cubes and search for pictures on your own set.
Game 2: Everyone search all visible sides of the cubes, but don't lay a finger on them.
Game 3: Pick blue or red cubes. Spot the pictures and move all your team's cubes to the other side of the game grid first!

-Includes a 4th game--great for younger kids
64648.name: Pictureka Kubes

64649.name: The Wasteland
64649.description:
User Summary:
The Wasteland is a a 22 pages scenario book only available to the subscribers of Ambush Alley Games Special Operation Group, a membership system that grants discounts and access to exclusive contents.

Unlike the previous year exclusive scenario book, Under The Black Flag, that was only for Ambush Alley, this booklet contains scenarios for the three core Ambush Alley Games rules.

The three scenarios details engagements of the forces of the "Barony" of Harlin's Corner, a small town in a post-apocalypse USA.


Scenario 1 - In the Rat's Alley - For Ambush Alley



A Squad of Baron's Rangers find themselves in the middle of a Raider's Camp, they must fight their way out running and gunning! The Raider's mission is much simpler, kill them all!



Scenario 2 - Agony in Stony Places - For Force on Force



A Small force of Harlin Corner must resist the onslaught of a scouting force from the Ominious Central Republic long enough for the reinforcements from the Corner to arrive. The Central republican forces must try to sweep away the defenders and get closer to the Barony, failing that, they must report to the Republic command the strength of the local resistance.



Scenario 3 - Fear in a Handful of Dust - For Ambush Z



A simple mission to recover a cache of medical supplies from a wasteland city turns into a nightmare as the Baron's rangers are attacked by zombies!


The booklet also contains information regarding the Barony Forces, Central Republic forces, Raiders, Zombies, Mutants and Grey Aliens to design other scenarios in the setting.

The booklet is available only as a download.

64650.description:
100 Points Rummy is a simple, casual card game in the 100 Points line of games that uses 100 Points cards.

In 100 Points Rummy players try to get a four-card hand totaling 100 points. Each time they do, they score the hand. The first player with 400 points wins the game.

The game can be played with 2 or more players.

You need 1 set of 100 Points cards per player to play the game.
64650.name: 100 Points Rummy

64651.description: The Warpstone Chronicles is the fifth monthly Battle Pack installment of The Corruption Cycle, the first linked expansion series for Warhammer: Invasion, a card game of intense warfare, clever kingdom management, and epic questing. This 40 card pack contains 20 different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Warhammer: Invasion metagame.
64651.name: Warhammer: Invasion – The Warpstone Chronicles

64652.name: TFOS Does WinterFest!
64652.description:
From back cover:

What happens when Winter descends on Albert Einstein High? More laughs and fun than you've had since...Summer! Join in for rollicking adventure in the world of R. Talsorian Games Teenagers From Outer Space. Old Man Withers Winter Wonderland has rolled into town, and with him WinterFest! Can the Teeners survive a frolick in the snow? And what does the CIA have to do with this, anyway? TFOS does WinterFest! is an AdventurePak for 4-6 Teeners from Teenagers From Outer Space. TFOS is required to use this product, as well as a sense of humor! Bonus! New Powers! New Gadgets! And Much, Much More!

64653.name: Rat Race
64653.description:
Rat Race is a fast-paced card game about big business. Payers hire Clients and Employees, win Contracts, and use their Big Bucks to buy Perks for their office.

On each turn, you collect income from your Clients, plus your base income of one buck each turn. You may attempt to play one Contract each turn for additional income. Next, play as many cards from your hand as you can afford. You can hire more Clients who boost your future income, hire Employees who increase your Status and protect you from certain Events, and you can play Events to trash or steal your opponents' best stuff.

You also buy Perks for your office, which is what gives you the most game-winning Status points. Upgrade your metal desk to a Mahogony Desk. Enjoy the view from your 40th story window. Spruce up the place with a Private Washroom, Masseuse, or an Objet D'Art. If you complete a 3x3 office, you also get a 3-point bonus.

Once the draw deck is empty, each player adds up his or her Status Points. The player with the highest Status total wins.

Official website:
http://www.wunderland.com/WTS/Chort/ratrace/index.html

64654.name: Gogo's Crazy Bones
64654.description:
Gogo's Crazy Bones are a collectible, mini game toy sensation. They are small, colorful figures whose gaming origins date back to Ancient Greece where children played by bouncing and throwing knuckle bones.

Many different games can be created using Crazy Bones, but there are instructions for several games available in various Crazy Bones publications. Among them are:

Scoring: Throw five Crazy Bones and score for how they land.
On Line: Throw Crazy Bones as close to a line as possible.
Battle: Line up a bunch of Crazy Bones across from another opponent and flick them into each other. Last one standing wins.
K.O.: Stand Crazy Bones inside a circle. Use other Crazy Bones to knock them out.
In Flight: Throw a Crazy Bones in the air and try to pick up others on the ground and catch the thrown Crazy Bones before it hits the ground.
Basket: Throw Crazy Bones into or through a target.

64655.name: Dragon (Issue 64 - Aug 1982)
rpgissuearticle: Featured Creatures: Official AD&D monsters for your campaign
From The Sorceror's Scroll: New weapons from another "great mind"
Greyhawk's World: News, Notes and Views of the Greyhawk Campaign
ROBOTS: Mechanical sidekicks for TRAVELLER players
You haven't lived until you've done The Assassins' Run
64655.description:
Vol. VII No. 2 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Tim Hildebrandt.

This issue featured PLANET BUSTERS - a game for 2-4 spacemen by Tom Wham and Jim Ward. The victory conditions for the game were accidently left out, and were printed on pg. 3 of the next issue, #65.

64656.description:
Players are merchants in the colonial U.S., trading wares such as maize, tobacco, animal pelts, weapons and alcohol with Native American villages. In some villages, you trade your wares for other wares. In other villages, for your wares, you receive wampum--bands of shells and beads used as currency by American Indians--and subsequently the white European settlers as well. The types of wares you are trading and the types in the village where you are trading determine whether you will get wares or wampum.
