The game also uses cards, one deck (of 10) for each player (whose cards are somewhat different from those of the other player) to enhance the game. (They don't "drive" the game and they can be left out, if you’re so inclined.) The cards are part of a Resource system that gives the players a number of points which they can use to buy cards, rally units or bring in reinforcements. The choice is theirs, but there are far more choices than points.

The cards, themselves, give the players "Opportunities", from using their (or negating their opponent’s) tank capabilities, to getting more supplies, to special Breakthrough and Reaction movement.

Playing time for “Desert War Egypt” as averaged less than 3 hours, and the rules are only 8 pages, including rules for playing Solitaire.

Each game of Desert War Egypt includes full box, rules, one sheet of large 5/8” die cut thick counters, dice, two decks of 10 cards, and a thick card stock game board.

According to the back of the box, the game will include new and updated counters for MedWar Sicily, the first game using this system. Upcoming games using this system include East War Russia 1941, and Guns of August 1914.
64769.name: Desert War: Egypt, 1940

64770.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 50 - Jul 1999)
64770.description:
(user summary)
Last issue of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
dsa-news
battletech-news
shadowrun-news
book reviews
game reviews

Wunderwelten Jubilee
15 years of DSA
dreams in DSA (rules article)
shadowrun: proteus, a secret unraveled
battletech - a new age

shadowrun-scenario: Spuren im Sand
DSA-scenario: 30 Tage im Boron

64771.name: The Legend of the Steel General
64771.description:
From the back of the book

Become part of the Legend!

Play the first epic adventure of the Seven Avengers Saga. The adventure setting is the world of Arthad. With some modifications, the module may fit into any campaign, but modifications will have to be made to the background.

The adventure is for 4-5 PCs at 1-2 level.


User summary

The adventure will lead the characters into a war in which they will have to perform special operations.

64772.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 49 - May 1999)
64772.description:
(user summary)
issue 49 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
DSA-News
Shadowrun-news
battletech-news
book reviews
game reviews

Störtebecker (historical info)
DSA: heraldics
Armalion: rules preview
game theory, an introduction
shadowrun: riggers
World of Darkness: overview

Shadowrun-scenario: Wem der Sandmann einen Alptraum bringt
Word of Darkness-scenario: Das schwarze Herz

64773.name: The Andwan Legacy (d20)
64773.description:
From the back of the book

"The doors of the inn open and two half-orcs larger than elephants enter, scrutinizing everybody grimly. One of them makes a sign to the entrance, then a beautiful woman in a figure-hugging silk dress enters the tavern. Her face is almost completely hidden behind a black shroud, her walk is cat-like and she attracts the men's gazes

She approaches the portly innkeeper and talks briefly to him, then he points towards the PCs. The woman sits down at a reserved table behind a screen.

Straight away, one of the grim half-orcs approaches you and says in perfect Common: Begging your pardon sir, my lady wishes to speak with you, would you be so kind as to follow me to her table?"

This is a generic adventure set in a small town. It can be inserted easily into any campaign in any world. The adventure is designed for a party of 4-5 adventurers of 4-5 levels but it can be scaled easily by modifying the monsters and villains statistics.


User submitted information

This adventure is also available in an OSRIC version and an Iron Gauntlets version.

64774.name: Universal FX
64774.description:
User summary

Universal FX is a free d20 Modern supplement that details design rules for magic and psychic powers.

It also includes three advanced and prestige classes:

Demonchilde
Pure-Soul
Sorcerer

64775.name: Dragon (Issue 57 - Jan 1982)
rpgissuearticle: The Electric Eye: Computer Technology and Terminology
In Search of a James Bond
Leomund's Tiny Hut:Shield and weapon skills
Modern monsters: The perils of 20th-century adventuring
New skill for DragonQuest: The versatile Magician
Up on a Soapbox I: Play a villain? An evil idea
Up on a Soapbox II: Dungeons aren't supposed to be 'for men only'
64775.description:
Vol. VI No. 7 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Dean Morrissey.

This issue includes The Wandering Trees, the second prize-winning AD&D module from International Dungeon Design Contest II.

64776.name: Operation: Uruzgan
64776.description:
A sourcebook for Force on Force

From the publisher's website:

Written by Leigh Neville, author of the best-selling Osprey Press titles Special Operations Forces in Afghanistan and Special Operations Forces in Iraq, Operation: Uruzgan takes a detailed look at Australian operations in the Uruzgan Province of Afghanistan.

Operation: Uruzgan contains:

* 9 Historically Accurate Scenarios
* A Historical Overview of Operations in the Region Since Anaconda
* Special Rules to Represent the Unique Flavor of Taliban Operations in Uruzgan
* Special Rules to Represent the ADF’s Operations in Uruzgan, Including ROEs and COIN based tactics
* 5 New Vehicle Write-Ups, including the Bushmaster IMV
* Uruzgan Specific Fog of War Cards
* Uruzgan Specific Asset Cards
* Guidelines for Using Scenarios with Other Coalition Forces

64777.name: Dominion
64777.description:
Dominion is played on a 8×8 square board.
On each turn, each player must do one of the following things:

Drop a stone on a empty cell.
Jump a stone to an empty cell.
Pass its turn if he cannot drop or jump.




When all cells are occupied, the player with more stones wins.

64778.name: Giant Monster Rampage (third edition)
64778.description:
Have you ever wondered what it would be like to step into your favorite giant monster suit and go on a rampage? Well now's your chance! Giant Monster Rampage is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where giant monsters really exist. The game allows players to create and control one of several different types of monsters, from mutant animals to alien robots and everything in between. Giant Monster Rampage is unique in that it gives players complete control over the creation of their monster. Players can create an existing monster from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless. The object of the game is simply to cause as much damage and destruction as possible.

Giant Monster Rampage is a stand alone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle System™ game.

64779.name: Power Warriors
64779.description:
Power Warriors is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where an alien race is trying to enslave the Earth. The planet's only hope for survival is a group of young warriors. The game allows players to create and control a mighty warrior trained to fight using the mystical energy of life known as qi. Power Warriors is unique in that it gives players complete control over the creation of their warrior. Players can create an existing warrior from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless. The object of the game is simply to be the last warrior standing.

Power Warriors is a stand alone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle SystemTM game.

64781.name: Mix 'n' Match
64781.description:
Mix´n´Match is played on a 7x7 square board.
The board is occupied by stones except the middle cell.
The Mix player must jump on any orthogonal or diagonal direction and capture stones if they are different from each other.
The match player must jump on any orthogonal or diagonal direction and capture stones if they have the same color.
The player that cannot make any valid move,loses.

64782.name: The Rifter (Issue 20 - Oct 2002)
rpgissuearticle: From the Desk of Kevin Siembieda
64782.description:
From the Publisher:

Issue number 20 is packed with variety of material for Palladium Fantasy, Nightbane, Beyond the Supernatural and Rifts.

* Questions and Answers.
* An Interview with Kevin Siembieda.
* Nightbane "Themed" Morphus types and a ton of characteristic tables.
* Beyond the Supernatural: Last street adventure.
* Palladium Fantasy RPG: Shadow Beasts, Shadow Magic and teh Shadow Realm.
* Rifts Adventure centered around pre-Rifts technology.
* Rifts: Hook, Line & Sinkers.
* Rifts: Hammer of the Forge (fiction) - cliffhanger ending.
* News and what's coming from Palladium, and more.
* 112 pages of fun!

64783.name: Jumping Beans
64783.description:
Jumping Beans is played on a 7x7 square board.
The board is occupied by beans except the middle cell.
Each player starts with 24 beans.
Beans may move to an adjacent empty cell.
Beans capture by jumping over an enemy bean. Capturing is mandatory, and you must keep jumping and capturing as long as it is possible.
A player wins when it captures all enemy beans or when he moves his last remaining bean to the center cell.

64784.name: Par Golf
64784.description: Par Golf from National Games published in the 1950's is described on the game cover as a 'fascinating,authentic, new GOLF GAME'.

64785.name: Chameleons
64785.description:
Chameleons is played on a 7x7 square board.
The board is occupied by Chameleons except the middle cell.
Each player starts with 24 Chameleons on his color.
A Chameleon may move to any adjacent empty cell.
A Chameleon that remains on a different color for more than one round will change itself to match that color.
The central cell is always considered to be the opposite color of the Chameleon that occupies it.
A Chameleon captures by jumping over an enemy Chameleon.
Captures are multiple and compulsory.
The player that captures or converts all enemy Chameleons wins.

64786.name: The Game Of Tennis
64786.description: The game of Tennis from National Games circa 1940's. In this tennis game one uses a die and a pawn to represent the tennis ball which players try to rally back and forth over the net. Throw too small a number, and your ball wouldn’t make it over the net. Too big a number, and you would overshoot the back line.

64787.name: Dragon (Issue 58 - Feb 1982)
rpgissuearticle: Aiming for Realism in Archery: Longer ranges, truer targets
Leomund's Tiny Hut: Beefing up the cleric
A Long Bow Isn't Always a Strong Bow
SPELLMINDERS: A DRAGON Magazine playing aid
Swords: Slicing Into a Sharp Topic
64787.description:
Vol. VI No. 8 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Clyde Caldwell.

This issue included SPELLMINDERS - Counters for keeping magic-user and cleric spells straight, and the first in a series on nonhumans - Dwarves: A Special Section.

64788.name: 40 Alchemical Items
64788.description:
User summary

40 Alchemical Items is a d20 System supplement that tries to improve the usefulness of the Craft (Alchemy) skill by providing 40 more items that can be crafted by using it.

64789.name: Honor & Corruption
64789.description:
From the back of the book

There are the honored, the corrupted, and the dead.

This supplement for the d20 fantasy game system allows you to implement deeds of honor and the subtle manipulations of corruption in your campaign. Inside is a detailed honor and corruption system–honor rewards–corruption effects–two new races–two new subclasses–and much more!

64790.name: Polis
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50
64790.description:
"Card and Dice Game for 2-6 players. Greek City State Theme."

The players compete for control of ten Greek city states. The first player to control four cities or collect 100 victory tokens wins the game.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play.

64791.name: Phillips H. Lord's Gang Busters
64791.description: This game circa the 1930's was Law & Order type game with players playing either the good guys or the bad guys. The personality of each of the bad guys was different allowing for slightly different rules for each.

64793.description:
A card game based on the Prince Valiant comic strip.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. The game requires a custom deck of approximately 120 cards and a set of coins or poker chips to use as Victory Tokens.

The deck is composed of seven types of cards: Trait, Plot, Location, Woman, Ally, Villain, and Foe. Players are awarded Victory Tokens for playing melds, with larger melds receiving more tokens. The first player to obtain ten Victory Tokens wins the game.
64793.name: Chronicles of Prince Valiant

64794.name: Dragon (Issue 59 - Mar 1982)
rpgissuearticle: Gypsies: A curse or a blessing - or both!
The Great Kingdom and the Knights of Doom: Notes from The World of Greyhawk Fantasy Setting
64794.description:
Vol. VI No. 9 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Jim Holloway.

This issue included Exonidas Spaceport: An adventure for Traveller characters, and the second in a series on nonhumans - Halflings: A Special Section.

64795.name: New World Conquest
64795.description:
"Board and card game depicting the colonization of the Americas circa 1492-1760."

The players portray European powers (Spain, Portugal, France, England, and Holland) exploring the American continents. The map is randomly constructed during the course of play. Card play determines what actions a player can take each turn.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play the game. The components consist of an 8x5 grid board, 50 terrain tiles, approximately 170 cards, 39 Indian tribe counters, Gold tokens, and Victory Point tokens.

64797.name: Urbs Romana
64797.description:
"Tile laying game for 2-4 players. Players are constructing a city of the Roman Empire."

The game is played on an 8x8 grid board such as a standard chess board. During the course of the game the players fill the board with tiles representing different structures and resources found in a Roman city.

The players score points based on various factors, including tile type and location. Control markers are used to denote which player played a tile to aid in scoring. The object is to have the most victory points once the board has been filled.

64798.name: The Stock Exchange
64798.description: A stock market manipulation game, in which players move around a board buying, selling and trading stocks. In addition to the usual fluctuation of share values and events (from the 'Bulls' and 'Bears' cards), the game introduces more sophisticated ideas such as buying and calling stock options, margin buying, and cornering the market.

64799.name: Battle of Camlann
64799.description:
"The last battle of King Arthur, where Arthur was mortally wounded and Mordred was slain. Card game for 2 Players."

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. The game is played using a custom deck of approximately 50 cards. The cards represent individual knights, weapons, magic, troops, events, traits, and mortal wounds.

A series of ten hands are played. The winner is the first player to win three hands in a row, win six of the ten hands, or to kill the opponent's leader.

64800.name: Anatolia 1000 BC
64800.description:
"War game for 2-6 players. Each player controls a civilization in the area of Asia Minor circa 1000 BCE. Each turn represents 10 years."

The players expand their competing civilizations across Asia Minor while amassing resources. Knowledge cards are purchased to help advance, benefit, or protect a player's civilization. Random event cards generate unexpected bonuses or catastrophes.

This is a free, online rules set which describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. Components include an area movement map of Asia Minor, seven sets of uniquely colored counters, six player resource mats, a victory point track consisting of 100 spaces, two custom decks of cards, and six and ten sided dice. An area movement map is available for download from the Warp Spawn site.

64801.name: Shooter's Guide: Cold Warriors
64801.description:
From the publisher:

Shooter's Guide: Cold Warriors is 93 Games Studio's fourth weapon supplement for the Twilight: 2013 roleplaying game. It includes detailed Reflex System traits for 16 battle rifles and their variants, ranging from the first pre-WWII examples of the breed to those of the middle Cold War. This dual-statted product also provides traits for agents to deploy these weapons in Spycraft 2.0 missions. Lock and load, rifleman - the Known-Distance Range awaits!


Full Weapons List:

* Ag-42 and Ag-42B (6.5x55mm)
* AVS-36 (7.62x54mm)
* Beretta BM5, BM59 Alpini and BM59 Mk. IV (7.62x51mm)
* CETME Model B (7.62x51mm)
* FG 42 (8mm Mauser)
* FN 49 (7mm Mauser, 7.62x51mm, .30-06, 7.65mm Argentine, 8mm Mauser)
* FN FAL, FAL Para, FALO, and L1A1 SLR (7.62x51mm)
* G41(M), G41(W)
* G43 (8mm Mauser)
* H&K G3A3, G3A4, and G3KA4 (7.62x51mm)
* Hakim (8mm Mauser) and Rashid (7.62x39mm)
* Howa Type 64 (7.62x51mm)
* M14 (7.62x51mm)
* MAS-49 (7.5x54mm MAS)
* SiG SG 510 (7.62x51mm) and Stgw 57 (7.5x55mm)
* SiG SG 542 (7.62x51mm)
* SVT-38, SVT-40 andAVT-40 (7.62x54mm)

64802.name: Gemerator
64802.description:
From the cover -

How often have you, as a GM or as a player, encountered a description of a gemstone that goes something like this:

GM: “You have overcome the last trap in the ancient temple. Ahead of you stands the stone statue you have been seeking, a pair of red gems for eyes.”

Players: “What kind of gems?”

GM: Checks a small table in his book that isn’t detailed enough and tries to think on his feet. Remembering that rubies are usually red he says, “Uh, they’re rubies.”

Players: “How big are they?”

GM: With no clue how to figure out how big the two rubies are, he says “Uh, the statue is only 10 inches tall so the rubies aren’t that big.”

Players: “Are the rubies cut? What shape are they?”

GM: Slightly curses his players and wonders if he could just convince the party that the statue was never really there in the first place...

Maybe this hasn’t happened to you, or maybe not to this degree but, at one time or another, most GM’s have encountered a situation like that. Maybe it’s the treasure just generated on the random treasure table in the rulebook that says that the monster the party just defeated has 1d8 gems. What kind of gems are they? How valuable are they? What do they look like?

Now you can answer all of these questions with the Gemerator!

With the Gemerator you can create gems of 75 different types, each with it's own elements of size, cut, color and value. This allows you to create millions of different gems quickly and easily.

Also included are sample images of each gem type so that you can get an idea of what the gems look like and show them to your players!

The Gemerator is designed to allow you to create detailed gems for use not only in your d20 system campaign, but in ANY setting!

64803.name: Escalation
64803.description:
From the rules:

"Escalation is a game simulating political and military struggle during the cold war. The object of the game is to accumulate 20 VP by controlling Strategic Theatres. Competition on a Strategic Theatre could be started by triggering a local Crisis. Control over a Strategic Theatre could be gained using political means. Or, if you are a ruthless warmonger, you can make the guns roar. Or even start a nuclear weapon race."

Escalation is a print and play card game. Components include a custom deck of cards (composed of Crisis, Political, Special, and War Unit Cards) and a set of Strategic Theater boards (Europe, Middle East, Asia, Africa, North America, South America, U.N. Council, Sea Control, and Nuclear Weapons Race).

64804.name: The Olympic Game
64804.description: This trivia game is played in two stages: you compete first to acquire rings in the Olympic colours, then to acquire bronze and silver medals before winning. Questions are read from cards or, optionally, provided by a DVD with images, video clips and further reading. There are more than 2000 questions in all.

64805.description:
A mini expansion for the game Infinite City consisting of 6 new tiles: one Guild Hall tile and 5 Salvage Yard tiles.

The Guild Hall adds an end-game bonus for the player(s) controlling it and the Salvage Yard forces more turned over tiles onto the board (plus adds a little more interaction).

The Salvage Yard tiles are all similar in design and share the same text. However, one has a silver border and one is worth an extra 3 points.
64805.name: Infinite City: Guild Hall and Salvage Yard

64806.description:
From the web site:

The Empires in America Expansion Kit includes the latest errata and plenty of new Optional Rules for the struggle for a continent in North America. Among its 24 additional cards are two additional French and two additional British Leaders, and plenty of new Action, Provincials, British and World Event cards to make the game's narrative much more compelling.

Optional Rules include: Fortress Garrisons, Leader Morale, Governing, and The Royal Navy. A special historical notes section includes Standing Orders: Rodgers' Rangers, and a commentary on those famous Standing Orders.

Game Components:


One instructions sheet with new Optional Rules and Historical Notes
Twenty-four new cards
64806.name: Empires in America Expansion Kit
boardgamefamily: Victory Point Games States of Siege Series

64808.name: Attack! 7-8 Player Expansion
64808.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Attack! 7-8 player Expansion is a set of Black and White runners (both naval and land units) for the new rule set.

Please note: You need Attack! and Attack! Deluxe Expansion to use the Attack! 7-8 player Expansion.

64810.name: A Very Kobold X-mas!
64810.description:
Eat Dancer, Eat Prancer!

User Summary:

Kobolds set out to steal Santa's "Great List" of all the world's girls and boys, armed with both weapons and a security code provided by disgruntled Gnomes.

64811.name: The Sorcerer's Crown
64811.description:
Super Endless Quest Adventure Gamebook #9

From Back Cover:

Now you can experience all the thrills of playing the ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game by yourself-- in book form!

ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Adventure Gamebooks use a simple, unique role-playing game system based on the popular ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game, incorporating two standard six-sided dice, hit points, skill points, experience points, and much more.

THE SORCERER'S CROWN continues Carr Delling's quest for his magical heritage as his archrival Arno's corrupt paladin's spread their evil influence across the land.

ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Adventure Gamebooks read like books, play like games, and offer a thrill a minute-- with YOU as the hero!

Book 2 of The Kingdom of Sorcery Trilogy.

35 possible endings.

64812.name: Cranium Dice Game
64812.description:
Players roll dice then flip a card that directs them to complete one of four different activities that incorporate the Cranium themed dice:

1. Complete sentences by spelling words with letters on rolled dice.
2. Doing simple math problems with numbers on dice.
3. Finding dice with specific pictures on them.
4. Creating a sculpture out of cards and dice.

Game was created for and sold exclusively through Starbucks during the 2009-2010 Holiday season

64813.name: Dragon (Issue 118 - Feb 1987)
rpgissuearticle: "Arrrgh!!!": A painful topic for AD&D game characters
"Surely, You Joust!": The "game" of chivalry and knighthood for AD&D games
A Day at the Faire: Life at a typical fantasy tournament
A Hero's Reward: The hero-point system for the AD&D game
Nibar's Keep: The game of magical arena dueling
On Target: Archery competitions for AD&D gaming
Out of the Stone Age: PC Neanderthals in the AD&D game
The Warlock Redux: Adam Warlock and friends from the Marvel Universe
Unfriendly Fire: War, revolution, and secret agents
64813.description:
Vol. XI No. 9 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art: The final piece in a series of fantastic chess paintings makes its appearance on the cover of this issue. Denis Beauvais's The Draw is actually a self-portrait; Denis is wearing one of his (quite real) fantasy costumes in the role of the Black King. The intense rivalry that one feels between the Black King and the onrushing viewer perfectly symbolize the theme of this issue: the competition within games themselves. (from the contents page)

This issue featured COMPETITION & TOURNAMENTS: Games within games - five articles on tournaments in AD&D.
It also listed the "Gamers' Guide," which was an index of all the advertising in the issue and "TSR Previews," a list of upcoming products from TSR.

64814.name: Lords of Doom
64814.description:
Super Endless Quest Adventure Gamebook #10

From Back Cover:

Now you can experience all the thrills of playing the ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game by yourself-- in book form!

ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Adventure Gamebooks use a simple, unique role-playing game system based on the popular ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game, incorporating two standard six-sided dice, hit points, skill points, experience points, and much more.

In LORDS OF DOOM, you, the elf Gilthanas, must somehow seek out the eggs of the good dragons so the powerful creatures will be free to combat the wicked Queen of Darkness herself!

ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Adventure Gamebooks read like books, play like games, and offer a thrill a minute-- with YOU as the hero!

8 possible endings.

64815.name: Clash of the Sorcerers
64815.description:
Super Endless Quest Adventure Gamebook #11

From Back Cover:

Now you can experience all the thrills of playing the ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game by yourself-- in book form!

ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Adventure Gamebooks use a simple, unique role-playing game system based on the popular ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game, incorporating two standard six-sided dice, hit points, skill points, experience points, and much more.

CLASH OF THE SORCERERS brings you to the exciting climax of the KINGDOM OF SORCERY gamebook trilogy, as Carr Delling confronts his old enemy, the archmage Arno, in an attempt to save the land from corruption.

ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Adventure Gamebooks read like books, play like games, and offer a thrill a minute-- with YOU as the hero!

Book 3 of The Kingdom of Sorcery Trilogy.

26 possible endings.

64816.name: Showdown! Battle Royal
64816.description:
Showdown! is a turn based card game. Each player starts with a leader that is out of play and five cards (max hand size). Two cards are drawn each turn and the players may play any number of soldiers and weapons on his/her turn. In order to attack another player's soldier he/she must have an attack card. The attacker chooses both his soldier and the target soldier and may disarm the target with a disarm card. The defender may respond at this point with a disarm if he/she has one. Each player in the fight rolls a die and adds up the bonuses from weapons, upgrades and one shot cards. The highest number wins with ties going to the defender. The loser may play a reroll card on his/her opponent if the player has one. Once three soldiers are in a players soldier discard pile, that players leader is in play and may attack. The leader may only be attacked if the player has no other soldiers out. Be the last one left with a leader in play and win the battle!

This card based battle game that will require both strategy and luck. Get ready to choose a side in this epic fight that will answer the question once and for all. Who's cooler?

This set combines Ninjas, Pirates, Knights and the Undead!

Play your soldiers! Protect your leaders! Equip them with weapons and accessories! Play attack cards on your opponents soldiers in order to clear the way to their leader. Roll the dice and add your bonuses and hope it's more than your opponent. He rolled a 6? Play your card that forces him to reroll! Why not disarm him before attacking next time? Do you have your base card that gives a bonus to all your soldiers? Find the weakest link and kick him while he's down!

Kill all your opponents leaders and be the last one standing to win!

64817.name: The Space Gamer (Issue 15 - Jan 1978)
rpgissuearticle: Ya Wanna Buy a Used World?
64817.description:
Table of Contents

Features
Wizard: a designer's introduction by Steve Jackson
Olympica: a designer's introduction by Lynn Willis
Byte the Bullet by Scot Bayless
Robotics for Traveller by Tony Watson
Floating Hulks by Donald Brown
OGRE Update by Steve Jackson
Orcs and Their Weapons by Paul C. Wagner
Ya Wanna Buy A Used World? by Brian McCue
Hot Stuff! by Jerry D. Bell
Imperium: a review by Tony Watson
Lords of Valetia: a review by Brian Esterson

Columns
Where We're Going (by Howard Thompson)
Darnigame Report
News & Plugs
Books (by G. Arthur Rahman & Howard Thompson)
Comics
Letters

This was the first issue in the traditional 8.5 by 11 format

Cover Art: Clark Bradley

64818.name: Brixbrix's Field Guide to the Creatures of Ados
64818.description:
From the cover -

Got monsters? We do. You can, too, with Brixbrix's Field Guide to the Creatures of Ados!

Inside, you will find everything you need to test your players against over 50 new creatures, from aberrations to vermin, with 12 new dragons, 8 new undead (including undead plants), 4 new PC races, 4 new creature templates, and more!

Each entry is complete with a creature description, vital statistics and game rules, an example encounter featuring the new creature, and 3 adventure hooks (including pre-generated NPCs) in order to help you get these creatures into your game today!

Not only that, but we have included 16 new items, 5 new spells, and rules for alternate uses for existing spells, all based around these new creatures. What are you waiting for? Open it up and start playing today!

64819.description:
From publisher's website:

"Get your family moving with the Eric Carle From Head to Toe Game! This game develops a child's self-esteem and confidence. Players flip over cards to see who can do various moves with their bodies like Can You Wiggle Your Hips? Everyone who answers I Can Do It! does the action. This game encourages imagination as children act out images on the cards, and coordination as children learn to move all parts of their bodies."
64819.name: From Head to Toe

64820.name: The Space Gamer (Issue 16 - Mar 1978)
64820.description:
Table of Contents

Features
Layin' It On The Line by Edward C. Cooper
Classics Simulated by Glenn L. Williams
Harmonious Fists in Melee by David James Ritchie
Alpha Omega — corrections & revisions by Kenneth W. Burke
Demons! by Bruce M. Mickelson
Matchmaker by Workman
The Warlord Game by David James Ritchie
Atlantis: 12,500 B.C. by Tracy Harms
War of the Ring by Tony Zamparutti
Invasion: America by Tony Van Lien
U.F.O. & Star Wars by Norman S. Howe

64821.name: Classical Conquests
64821.description:
A game of ancient civilizations in conflict over the European continent and surrounding territories. "For 2-4+ players."

The players choose to play as one of 12 ancient civilizations of the region. Each civilization starts with two traits, such as arts, metallurgy, ship building, religion, etc. Traits provide certain resources or benefits. Traits can be developed and improved during the Research Phase.

Each territory on the map is marked with a type of resource. The distribution of the resources is randomly determined each game. Resources are used for various purposes, including supporting your civilization, building cities, and supporting research attempts.

This is a free, online rules set which describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. Components include an area movement map of Europe, a set of six tokens for each player (Armies, Fleets, Villages, Cities, Monuments, and Resources), a resource chart for each player, a common resource pool card, and six-, eight-, and twelve-sided dice. An area movement map is available for download from the Warp Spawn site.

64822.name: Imperialism
64822.description:
From the rules:

"Rule the world in the XIX Century"

"This is the XIX Century. Industrialism is growing ruthlessly, while both Armies and Navies are equipped with increasingly efficient weapons. The Minor Nations are deprived of their Resources by cunning Diplomats, while the Major Powers become richer and more powerful. Empires struggle for supremacy both in the Military and the Economy spheres."

"Gold, Blood and Iron will determine the ultimate Ruler of the World!"

Imperialism is a print and play card game. Components include a custom deck of cards (composed of Territory, Work, Army, Navy, and News Cards), Warehouse tabletop cards for each player, a TradeBoard tabletop card, and a sets of revenue, resource, and item tokens.

64823.name: Die Phileasson Saga
64823.description:
User summary

The Phileasson-Saga is a four-part adventure campaign for Das Schwarze Auge.

The famous Thorwalian captains Phileasson Foggwulf and Beorn der Blender set out on a race around the whole continent of Aventurien to gain fame and the title of King of the Seas. During this hazardous journey, the group of adventurers also gets the chance to reveal an elven secret.

The four original adventures were:


A021: Folge dem Drachenhals
A023: Auf der Spur des Wolfes
A026: Wie der Wind der Wüste
A027: Inseln im Nebel


This book is based on the earlier compilation A090: Die Phileasson Saga of all four adventures, but expands them with new material and updates all game statistics to 4th edition rules.

It comes with an A3 sized color map of the Inseln im Nebel (Isles in the Mist).

64824.name: Civ Builder
64824.description:
Two to four (or more) players represent one of ten world civilizations (Middle East, North Africa, India, China, Meso America, etc.)

Each civilization is rated for ten attributes (Conquest, Trade, Culture, Science, Agriculture, Religion, Sea, Government, Equestrian, and Engineering). The value of each attribute is randomly determined by rolling a die at the start of the game, with each civilization receiving a second cumulative die roll for a specified attribute in which that civilization excelled.

The gameplay involves drawing and trading cards in order to play melds. Playing a meld adds to a player's victory point total and increases the value of an attribute of the player's civilization. Playing a meld also conveys a specific bonus (such as stealing cards or victory points from other players) depending on the type of meld played. The winner is the player with the most victory points after twelve rounds have been played.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. The components include a custom card deck made up of twelve types of cards with nine copies of each card. Six-sided dice are also required for play.

64825.name: 25 Jahre Das Schwarze Auge: Band III – Die Soloabenteuer
64825.description:
User summary:

Band II - Die Gruppenabenteuer (Volume II - The Group Adventures) is a 25th anniversary limited reprint of the first Das Schwarze Auge solitaire adventures:


B05: Nedime - die Tochter des Kalifen
B11: Der Quell des Todes
B14: Die Schwarze Sichel
B07: Borbarads Fluch


1,000 numbered copies have been printed. The books are bound in black faux-leather.

64826.description:
It's just another day, get up, wash, go to work. What's different is that today the Earth has been invaded by aliens – it's just that nobody knows it yet. Deep underground mad scientists are raising monsters from the planet Moongha. Once fully formed they will emerge to spread terror and destruction. Cities will be laid waste to, and the human race will be hunted to extinction.

Through the sewers oozes the Bloob, quietly growing in size. The Drakoor, alien vampires, stalk the night, feeding off the unwary. Meanwhile, the strongest of the Moongha invaders, Mechoor, sucks in energy from the earth. Once sated it will rise to destroy whole cities with its heat ray. These are just a few of the monsters that will terrorise the people of Earth.

It can only be hoped that just as in the movies there's a hero around who can thwart their evil plans; otherwise there will be no more "just another day"s for anybody! But who's behind those evil plans? You! You are one of those sadistic, power-thirsty, psycho nerds, eager for revenge after a whole life of study, disregarded by everyone. All of you have received a visit from a mysterious flying saucer, carrying strange alien machinery – an engine that finally brought you POWER! And now you are ready to fight your insane struggle to be the first in destroying the human race. This time no "Klaatu barada nikto!" will stop you...

Moongha Invaders: Mad Scientists and Atomic Monsters Attack the Earth! is for three to four players and should take about ninety minutes to play. You have control of a number of different types of Moongha monsters. When you sit down to play, the side of the board closest to you is your monster display. There you will see the seven different types of monster. You will place your monster counters in these boxes. Note that some monster types have more than one counter.

The game lasts either eight or nine turns, depending on the number of players, although it may end before then if a player manages to get down all twenty of their damage cubes.

At the start of each turn a random number of actions are made available. Three of these actions relate to the monsters and allow you to create, attack, and move them. These actions are represented by orange, white, and purple tokens. There are three human action boxes, one that allows you to place a hero, the other two allow you to place military counters.

To create a monster you have to place a certain number of orange tokens in the monster box. Once the monster has been created you place it in one of the twelve cities on the board. When you do so, you place the monster on its hidden side. The monster is alive but as yet the world does not know of its presence. While hidden a monster is safe from attack and can build up its strength so that when it does attack it will cause carnage. Another player may attempt to reveal your monster by placing a hero counter in the same city.

Military units will try to destroy monsters. When you place a military unit or a hero, you can then attack with all military counters in that city. When a monster attacks a city, armor units will attack it first, then after that attack has been completed, any surviving infantry units will attack. All combat involves rolling dice and in all cases a roll of four or more is successful.

Each monster type has its own special abilities. Only three monsters are powerful enough to destroy entire cities; these are the Bloob, Mechoor, and Moogre. When you attack a city, you mark the damage you do with your colored cubes. At the end of the game, players score victory points depending on how many damage cubes they have in each city. Players also score points for the cities that were randomly assigned to them at the beginning of the game, depending on how much damage they have suffered. Points can also be scored for having vampires on the board and for killing other monsters with your Moogre monster.
64826.name: Moongha Invaders: Mad Scientists and Atomic Monsters Attack the Earth!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 65- Orleans & Evolution of a Gamer
I've Been Diced! episode 30: The games that got away
I've Been Diced! episode 39: Martin Wallace
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 85!

64827.name: Warped Diplomacy Classic
64827.description:
A web-published board game of European conflict between the Great Powers. Inspired by the game Diplomacy.

From the publisher's website:

"Heavily modified variant of the board game Diplomacy. Card play replaces written orders. Players should be familiar with basic concepts of the standard game such as Supply Centers, Provinces, Units, and Great Powers. Special movement rules (Kiel & Constantinople, etc.) still apply. Rules for Retreats, Building, Occupation, Civil Disorder, and Convoys still work in the spirit of the original game."

"The standard game takes place in the relatively peaceful (historically) period between the Franco Prussian War (also Russo-Turkish) and WWI. However, it will be noticed that the card flavor of the Battle Decks in this variant has a distinctly WWI flavor."

64828.name: Paper Rails USA
64828.description:
"Rail Road Building Theme. Pen and Paper Game: No cards or dice needed. This is a modified PnP version of Railroad Dispatch USA."

The game is played on a map of the United States marked with cities. The players build rail connections by drawing lines between the cities. Building rail lines is one of the means of acquiring Victory Points. Additional Victory Points are scored when the player duplicates the circuit covered by historical rail lines.

The game adds additional flavor to this basic framework through the Income, Research, and Stock Points tracked for each player's railway. A series of Events can affect these point values as well, based on historical events that influenced nineteenth rail travel in the United States.

The Income, Research, and Stock Point values also serve to increase a player's Victory Point total. Victory Points can also be scored based on the type of commodities produced in the cities connected to a player's rail lines.

Materials required for play: Two pens with different colored ink, a coin, a printout of the game map, and a copy of the scoring tables.

64829.name: Patzam
64829.description:
Patzam is a sort of moving 3D Tic Tac Toe where you remove the middle piece each time you make a row. The goal of the game is to get rid of your pieces and be the first to have only 2 left.

Rules:
Alternately, both players place one piece on one of the 18 spots of the 3D-board. When all the pieces have been played, middle pieces of any rows of the same color are removed.
Then, players successively slide one piece in order to make a row (and remove the middle piece) or block the opponent.
The first player who has only 2 of his own pieces left on the board is the winner.

64830.name: The 7:48 from Central Avenue
64830.description:
From the file's introduction

Shadow creatures adapt to life in a modern city with remarkable speed, particularly when they don't have any scruples about how they make their livings. In this brief adventure, a few such creatures move into a mundane subway station and quickly turn it into a nasty little dungeon.

The 7:48 from Central Avenue is an adventure set in the modern day, but it includes fantastic creatures and magic.

A Short Urban Arcana Adventure for Four 8th-Level Characters.

64831.name: Komikan
64831.description:
Komikan is a two-player abstract strategy board game from the Mapuches of Chile.

Rules
It is a hunt game using an expanded Alquerque board. Like all hunt games, there are two unequal forces at play. In Komikan, one player has only a single piece (usually called a "puma", "jaguar", "komikelu", "leon" or "ukuku"), which can move one space at a time or capture the other player's pieces by hopping over them.
The other player has twelve pieces (usually called "sheeps", "goats", "dogs" or "kukulis"), that can only move one space at a time, but not capture, and attempts only to surround and immobilize the puma or jaguar. All pieces must move and/or capture following the pattern on the board.

Board
The expanded Alquerque board consist of an Alquerque board and a triangular patterned board attached on one of its side. The sheeps or goats can also win the game by occupying every spaces on this triangle.
There are different triangular patterned board designs attached to the Alquerque board, and therefore Komikan has several variants. The standard triangular board has one horizontal line across the breadth of the triangle, and one vertical line along the length of the triangle.

According to Wikipedia, "Komikan may actually be the same game as Adugo."

64832.name: A Friendly Warning
64832.description:
From the file's introduction

No one in the modern world is well trained or well guarded enough to be completely impervious to harm. Despite the best and most modern safety measures, heads of state are still assassinated, rich and powerful individuals are still kidnapped and ransomed, the most valiant heroes still fall in battle, and terrorist attacks still take the lives of innocent victims. Life is fragile, and no matter how carefully it is guarded, some way always exists for a sufficiently fanatical opponent to end it.

Nevertheless, a certain haughtiness comes with experience. Typically, heroes who have defeated numerous threats to themselves, their loved ones, and their ways of life develop a certain pride in their ability to overcome the dangers of the world. All too often, however, this pride spills into overconfidence.

A Friendly Warning explores what happens when such experienced heroes become the targets of a man bent on proving that they are still vulnerable. This adventure can be set in any locale, but the best choice is a place in which the heroes feel safe and secure. The antagonist, Remi Leone, is stalking the heroes on their home ground, trying to get the better of them despite the fact that they have every possible advantage at their disposal.

A Short d20 Modern Adventure for Four 18th-Level Characters

64833.name: A Funny Thing Happened At Carousel #5
64833.description:
From the file's introduction

Not every adventure pits the heroes against malign forces bent on world domination. In fact, sometimes the most interesting situations occur completely by accident.

The series of misunderstandings that precipitates this adventure can without a doubt be solved quickly, quietly, and without any danger to life and limb. But considering how most heroes behave in the face of an unusual situation, such an outcome seems extremely unlikely.

A Funny Thing Happened At Carousel #5 is a real adventure, with real threats and real rewards. However, it’s anything but serious, and you as GM should plan to run it with tongue firmly in cheek. Those who do not like to mix a wisp of comedy with their adventures may want to look away before it’s too late.

A Short Adventure for Four 7th-Level Heroes

64834.name: Adelie 14
64834.description:
From the file's introduction

Not all international intrigue happens in presidential palaces, plush business offices, and smoky dives next to waterfronts. Some happens in the coldest, dreariest, most desolate places in the world. But regardless of the setting, the question is always the same: Who’s lying?

Adelie 14 is a d20 MODERN adventure set in the frozen wastes of Antarctica. In it, a group of 6th- to 8th-level characters becomes enmeshed in a deadly web of international intrigue and doublecross that spans more than half the globe.

A Short Adventure for Four 6th- to 8th-Level Heroes

64835.name: Trouble at Black Rock
64835.description:
From the file's introduction

The modern industrial world is full of unexplained accidents involving machinery that seemingly went haywire for no reason. There is a reason, of course, but few modern people are willing to accept it. In most cases, modern people would rather have an unexplained mystery than a truth that conflicts with the safe, logical parameters of their world. After all, machines can’t be alive, and they certainly can’t be possessed. Or can they?

A Short Adventure for Four Heroes of 3rd to 5th Level

64836.name: Blood Sugar
64836.description:
From the file's introduction

Everyone knows that too much candy is bad for your health, but never has that old adage been as literally true as it is in this adventure. Tales of cruel and deranged people tainting the candy they hand out to trick-or-treaters on Halloween have changed the entire culture of that holiday in America. But in Blood Sugar, a group of fanatical cultists takes the adulteration of children’s candy a step further. They break into the processing plant of a local candy manufacturer and use an arcane ritual to enchant a batch of confections, which they plan to distribute to the local children at an All Hallows Eve street fair.

A Short Urban Arcana Adventure for Four 10th-Level Characters

64837.name: Le Chien de L'Onyx
64837.description:
From the file's introduction

The emergence onto Earth of strange creatures from the shadows is nothing new. It has been going on throughout history, but at a much slower pace—a bare trickle, compared to the present rush.

One such trickle occurred in the year 1780...

64838.name: Crossing the Line
64838.description:
From the file's introduction

To most people, the word “winning” means completely subduing a foe. But victory need not be measured in such absolute terms. Some goals can be achieved merely by holding the opponent at bay for a long enough period of time.

When the goal is to hold off rather than physically overcome an adversary, the best tools are misdirection, obfuscation, outright prevarication, and any other techniques that can send the foe down the wrong track for a time. But when the clock is ticking, a good delaying tactic can be just as effective. Crossing the Line pits the heroes against an opponent whose goal has nothing to do with actually beating them. All this particular foe wants to do is keep them from going through the front door.

This adventure can be set in practically any locale. In fact, the details depend entirely on the backstory to which you (as GM) attach it. The antagonist, Remi Leone, should be able to apply his tactics to any desired location with only minor variations.

While Crossing the Line constitutes a complete adventure in its own right, it is best used in combination with another scenario. On his own, Remi Leone is unlikely to have sufficient motivation to interfere with the heroes, although you could certainly orchestrate a situation in which he does. As a gun for hire, though, he is more than happy to use his skills in the service of someone who has a more antagonistic relationship with the heroes.

A Short d20 Modern Adventure for Four 19th-Level Characters

64839.name: The Dead of Winter
64839.description:
From the file's introduction

As the days remaining on the calendar dwindle, it seems as though life does, too. The days grow shorter, the wind grows colder, and all around us the landscape turns stark and barren. Trees take on the appearance of skeletons, and the bright leaves of autumn are buried under freshly fallen snow.

The world becomes even more chilling when its metaphorical death is accompanied by murder most macabre. Bodies have begun to turn up all around the city—bodies that have been mauled by some ferocious beast until they are practically unrecognizable.

The Dead of Winter sends the heroes in pursuit of the monster behind these grisly killings. Can they solve the case before this blood stains the pristine promise of the coming new year?

A Short Urban Arcana Adventure for Four 12th-Level Characters

64840.name: Dire Wavelengths
64840.description:
From the file's introduction

A garbled, static-filled transmission in a foreign language emanates from a car radio’s speakers and tells the heroes to stop an actress from reaching the location of her movie shoot. But where does this transmission come from, and why can’t anyone else hear it?

Dire Wavelengths is an adventure that finds the heroes, wherever they may be. It is best used as a brief interlude between regular adventures in the campaign. The scenario outlines a task and describes those who oppose its completion. In addition, information is given about what “punishments” are levied against heroes who elect not to undertake the task at all.

A Short d20 Modern Adventure for Four 4th-Level Characters

64842.name: Vendemmia!
64842.description:
Players compete to purchase vineyards along the Italian peninsula.
By exploiting their own lands, they will produce wine with which they will realize the revenue necessary to develop their own activities.
Who will become the most famous?

The game is played in 6 turns.

Each turn is divided into 3 phases:
1. The arrangement of the turn
2. The choice of actions
3. The development of actions

The arrangement of the turn
Put 6 land cards on the table: get the first 4 from the stacks corresponding to the specific grape varieties.
Get the last 2 from the shared deck. These will be the lands that can be purchased in the turn.
For the successive turns, update the prices increasing the highest price to 7 and use the same gap for all other prices.

The choice of actions
Every player starting from the first will be able to do some actions. There is only one limit to the actions that can be done in a turn: that is the money necessary to do them.
These actions, that can be found on the corresponding table of the game board, are:
Modify the game order for the next turn
Turn a land into a DOCG area (where DOCG stays for “Denomination of origin inspected and guaranteed”)
Benefit from the events
Purchase the lands revealed on the turn
Develop your own production capacity (quantity)
Develop your general productive quality
Make one of your vineyards productive


The development of actions
All the actions choosed before will be acted in the game, in the exact order of them.


End of the game
The game ends at the end of the sixth turn.
In the last turn some bonus fame points will be distributed.
More specifically: fame points to the player who has got more points on the bonus vine production, fame points to the player who has got more lands for each of the 4 macro-areas, fame points to the player with more money, fame point for each line of the technological development equal to 3.


The winner is who has got more fame points.

64843.name: Counterpoint
64843.description:
This game is played with a joker and 6-Ace in four suits from a standard deck of cards. Each of the three players is dealt 12 cards and bids by discarding three cards simultaneously. The suit of those cards show how many points they bid, and the highest bidder has to take card-points in tricks as close as possible to his bid.

Reimplements: Ninety-Nine

64844.name: Cross Purposes
64844.description: This game is played with a standard deck of cards. The novelty in this otherwise simple trick-taking game is that one of the players (partnerships) decides the trumps, then the other decides the top (for example if 8 is the top then the ranking order of cards from high to low is 8765432AKQJ109 in each suit).

64845.name: The Horror
64845.description:
The Horror is a turn based combat set in a world where a mob of horrifying creatures (zombies, skeletons, or whatever you want) have overrun the world and the remaining survivors are just trying to live another day. The game can be played solo or with a group of friends.

The game allows players to create and control a survior trying to make good his escape from the horror infested playing field.

The object of the game can be as simple as getting from side of the playing field to the other alive or as complex as completeing several objectives before being allowed to escape.

64846.name: Departure
64846.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Called to face the pasts they hoped to leave behind, Lydia, Kennerly, Nara, and Taru leave the Reach for the homes they once knew. There, new enemies have been set against them, driven by the same dark force they hoped they had defeated. Now the people they once most trusted have become pieces in a game that may lead them down the road to their deaths.

64847.name: Card Sharp
64847.description:
Publisher Blurb:

It's that time of the year again, the Dealing Dale Fair. . . where traders from all over Eranon worth their salt congregate to barter, bargain, or simply undermine a rival's ventures to further their ownusually all three. This year's festivities, however, take an ugly turn when murders take center stage. Apparently, the victims are all depicted on a mysterious, arcane deck of cards, a fact that may alarm the characters when they discover their faces are on them as well. . .

The stakes at the bustling Fair are always highmore so when everyone decides to play for keeps.

Features:

- An introductory adventure for characters of 1st-3rd level for the Chronicles of Ramlar fantasy RPG.
- A plot emphasizing investigation and social interaction.
- A reusable setting that enables the GM to showcase the myriad races and cultures of Eranon, as well as a springboard for future adventures.
- New creatures and spells.

64848.name: No Hero
64848.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Legends are created by circumstances, not born to hovels with dirt floors. Champions train their entire lives for one single opportunity to stand in the stead of another, to pit their might against the best of another culture. Conquerors destroy civilizations and butcher the weak, rewriting history after the fact to show themselves as liberators. Heroes do not begin life in tiny villages with muddy streets where the stench of goats and sheep permeate the air and lofty goals of men are to feed their families through the winter. Albrim looked forward to a simple life but events came that he could not avoid. His innocence is swept away as the actions of a single day alter his viewpoint, his morals, and his beliefs. He must make a choice and all that he loves is stripped away.

64849.name: Into The Reach
64849.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In the land of Eranon, the Reach is a desolate place where people journey to forget who they are. Now, a menace rises from this wasteland, and he is hunting for someone. To keep the madman and his chaos behind the Reach, four adventurers with haunted pasts must rise to the challenge. But how can failed heroes bring hope to others when they doubt themselves?

64851.name: Elves (d20 3.5)
64851.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Wind of Intrigue: Elves unravels the mystery that is the elves. From the Divine Parents and the Glydym to the Nine Sacred Cities and Glymrae, from the Great Houses to the Accursed outcast, this sourcebook unlocks the secrets of the Land of the Tromek previously whispered only among the elves. Featuring detailed, valuable glimpses into the elves' highly intricate society, customs, beliefs, and daily life, Wind of Intrigue is the comprehensive guide to navigate the complex elven web of politics and understand Loerem's 'Oldest Race.'

64852.name: Panzer Clash
64852.description:
Panzer Clash is a light, card-based wargame about Second World War Panzer battles for 2 - 4 players.

Pick a side, either Axis or Allies, and build a deck of 40 cards out of a pool of 100 different cards in order to defeat your enemey.
The deck or Supply contains Factories, Units, Events and Terrain Modifiers. Factories are needed to build Units and Terrain Modifiers as well as to power Events. Units and Events, which usually belong to one or more of the four factions (Germans, Japanese, Americans and Soviets) are used to attack and deal damage to the opponent, have certain beneficial effects on the game or are used to weaken the opponent. For each point of damage a Player receives through Units and Events, he or she puts one card from his or her Supply (deck) onto his or her Junkyard (discard-pile). Is a player unable to draw a card from the Supply, he or she loses immediately.

This game started out as a retheme of my fantasy card game Elemental Clash and ended up being so much more...

Very special thanks to my historic advisor Bruno Abreu!!

64853.name: Dracula
64853.description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards including two jokers. Both players are dealt four cards and a card is put face up on the table players put their cards so they form at the end of the round a 3x3 grid. Then one player scores for the vertical, the other for the horizontal lines. The score depends on the cards in the row, but cards with the same color or suit increases the value of a line.

More information, including a 3 and a 4-player variant can be found at http://www.davidparlett.co.uk/oricards/dracula.html

64854.name: Campaign Sourcebook (d20 3.5)
64854.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The fantasy epic saga of Sovereign Stone returns in a new edition! Rediscover the world conceived by renowned fantasy artist Larry Elmore and popularized by Margaret Weis & Tracy Hickman in the best-selling Sovereign Stone novel trilogy from HarperCollins. Sovereign Stone Classic is a complete campaign setting for the d20 system, updated to version 3.5 rules. Everything uniquely Sovereign Stone has been revised and expanded. The already distinctive races (seafaring orks, nomadic marauder dwarves, feudal Japan-like elves, a half-dozen standout human cultures) are further highlighted with information compiled from several published sourcebooks. The critically acclaimed magic system makes spellcasting uncertain and enthralling?now with complete rules for designing your own spells! The character classes have been upgraded alongside new feats, skills, and task resolution. Joining the many innovative features in Sovereign Stone Classic is Destiny Points, which combines role-playing rewards with high drama to encourage and inspire truly heroic tales! Sovereign Stone Classic is a 224-page clear, concise portal to wondrous adventures. Discover what many loyal fans who made Sovereign Stone a top d20 campaign already know: a rich world vibrating with novelty and excitement at every turn!

64855.name: Putt'n Score
64855.description: Up to three players control mini-golfers and try to putt their golf balls onto a rotating golf course that contains a water trap, sand trap, 4 greens (valued 2,3,4, & 5 points), and a windmill on a green in the center. Players try to earn the most points.

64857.name: Shocking Quiz
64857.description: A fantastic challenge for shockaholics or quiz addicts, Shocking Quiz lets you test your general knowledge with this 4 player multiple choice quiz game. And if you don’t know the correct answer to one of the 600 questions your in for a shock....quite literally!

64858.description:
Seventh course for Formule Dé by Ludodélire. The course was included in the britisch version of the game.

38" x 25"; 182 spaces; 8 corners (four "2"); straights 30, 22, 19; "2" corners at end of the two longest straights

RAIN : 1-7 VARIABLE : 8-13 FINE : 14-20
64858.name: Formule Dé Circuit № 7: BRITISH GRAND PRIX – Silverstone Circuit

64860.description:
Eight course for Formule Dé by Ludodélire.

36" x 12"; 174 spaces; 10 corners (one "2"); straights 40, 24; "2" corner is at end of longest straight and preceeds second-longest; lots of scenery-only space on the board but track is well packed and folds back on itself in the area it does occupy

LLUVIA : 1-4 VARIABLE : 5-10 SOL : 11-20
64860.name: Formule Dé Circuit № 8: GRAN PREMIO DE ESPAÑA – Circuit de Catalunya

64861.description:
Ninth course for Formule Dé by Ludodélire.

40" x 14" (this oblong track is oriented along the diagonal); 127 spaces; 7 corners (four "2"s, all in a row); straights 18, 15, 14

PLUIE : 1-6 VARIABLE : 7-12 SOLEIL : 13-20
64861.name: Formule Dé Circuit 	№ 9: GRAND PRIX DU CANADA – Circuit Gilles Villeneuve

64862.description:
Tenth course for Formule Dé by Ludodélire.

35" x 22"; 187 spaces; 7 corners (two "2"s); straights 59, 39, 22; one of the "2" corners separates the two longest straights

CHUVA : 1-3 VARIABLE : 4-8 SOL : 9-20
64862.name: Formule Dé Circuit 	№ 10: GRANDE PREMIO DE BRASIL – Circuito do Interlagos

64863.description:
Eleventh course for Formule Dé by Ludodélire.

42" x 13"; 148 spaces; 6 corners (one "3", two "2"s); straights 35, 21, 19, 18; longest straight starts & ends with "2" corners

RAIN : 1-5 VARIABLE : 6-13 FINE : 14-20
64863.name: Formule Dé Circuit № 11: JAPAN GRAND PRIX – Suzuka Circuit

64864.name: Fantasy Heroes Skirmish
64864.description:
"RPG-like card game for 2 players, based on [Lloyd] Krasner's Superhero Slugfest Card Combat rules."

"Each player gets one deck. A deck represents a party of adventurers, all its members, and all of their special abilities. A party has 6 Members. A deck has 60 cards."

"Each hero is represented by 10 cards: Five of these are Character cards. The five character cards have a Force value and the name of the hero. The other five are Ability cards. The five ability cards have a Force modifier and the name of the hero which belongs to."

The players fight a series of battles through card play. To win the game you must kill or wound all 10 of your opponent's heroes.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. Rules and print-and-play components are available on the Yahoo group Fermwarp.

64865.name: Geisterjäger John Sinclair: Das Abenteuerspiel
64865.description:
The German core book of John Sinclair.

Translated from the back of the book:

When reading the books, did you ever feel the urge to stand up and shout: "Don't go that way, John, don't?" Now you can prove that you've the guts to be a ghosthunter on your own!

This adventure game contains everything you need to follow the footsteps of John Sinclair and his team and fight the demonic forces spreading all over the world. Also included in this book is the kickoff for long-spanning campaign, taking place parallel to the Black Death meta plot of the novel series.

64866.description:
Twefth course for Formule Dé by Ludodélire.

38" x 17"; 152 spaces; 8 corners (two "2"s); straights 21, 18 (pit), 18, 14, 14; longest straight starts with "2" corner
RAIN : 1-6 VARIABLE : 7-11 FINE : 12-20
64866.name: Formule Dé Circuit № 12: SOUTH of AFRICA GRAND PRIX – Kyalami Circuit

64867.name: Omaha Beach - Mission Pack 1
64867.description:
From the back of the book

Omaha Beach is the first Mission Pack for the World War II Heroes Roleplaying Game. It is designed for from 4-8 1st level regular infantry characters.

6 June 1944
Normandy, France
0630 Hours

Storm the beaches of Normandy with the 29th Infantry Division on D-Day. Board your Higgins Boat and relive one of the greatest amphibious assaults in history.

You and your squad hit the sands of France on Omaha Beach. You fight your way up the beach over the embankments and barbed wire to storm the heavy German defenses.

Omaha Beach includes:

60 full color pages
Detailes mission plans
Numerous custom maps
Premade characters or roll your own.
Historical context
Counters, chits, geomorphs and minis for building your own virtual battlefield.

64868.description:
Thirteenth course for Formule Dé by Ludodélire.

43" x 19" (diagonally oriented); 146 spaces; 8 corners (two "2"s); straights 20, 17, 14, 11, 11, 11; longest (pit) straight ends with "2" corner

PLUIE : 1-7 VARIABLE : 8-13 SOLEIL : 14-20
64868.name: Formule Dé Circuit № 13: SAN MARINO – Autodromo Enzo & Dino Ferrari

64869.name: Counter Collection: Heroic 1 (4E)
64869.description:
From publisher's website:

Tabletop tokens to challenge Heroic Tier characters
15 pages of heavy cardstock-mounted, die-cut full-color counters - just punch and play! Every Heroic level monster from the first core Monster Book. Over 600 1-inch counters, and more than 100 2-inch counters. Flip the counters over to reveal a "bloodied" side with the monster name.

64870.name: GolfEgo
64870.description:
Taken from the official website:

Golf Board Game: GolfEgo™
...... a great way to play the game

GolfEgo is fun! It's easy to understand and play, whether you're a regular golfer or not.

Now everyone can play a round of golf, young and old and right at home. And just as exciting as the real game!

GolfEgo™ is an innovative board game based on golf. Like when you are playing outside on the green, this board game is a challenge to your Ego. Play 9, 18 or just a few holes. Create your own rules, or play one of the available games like stroke play, match play, skins or fun golf, a kind of Ludo...

The 4 pawns represent the players and have been designed just for this game, and so are the 4 dices which are the virtual clubs in your bag. So with GolfEgo™ you can decide which one to use. Playing safe or taking a risk, just like the real thing!

The game itself:
Much attention has been given to detail. Inside the colourful box there is a nicely designed board which covers 18 holes (9 holes each side). The board features ponds, bunkers and greens. It even has a clubhouse! Of course the box is delivered to you with dices, pawns and a notebook for writing down the scores.

64871.name: Counter Collection: Paragon 1 (4E)
64871.description:
From publisher's website:

Tabletop tokens to challeng Paragon Tier characters
An 18 page PDF of full-color counters - just print, punch and play! Every Paragon level monster from the first core Monster Book. Over 270 1-inch counters, 125 2-inch counters, and 30 huge 3-inch counters. Print as many as you need to field an army at your game table.

Note: These also come in a physical, die-cut form.

64872.name: The Castle of Shadows
64872.description:
A Free Counter Collection

From the pdf:
This special Counter Collection is a demonstration of Fiery Dragon's ongoing commitment to the fans of the world's premiere roleplaying game. As a new edition approaches, this Counter Collection is offered to remind fans that we've created counter images for thousands of fantasy creatures, including this specific set that you may find useful for any new campaign, one-off adventure, or playtesting that strikes your fancy.

Welcome to the Counter Culture.

64874.name: Old Janx Spirit
64874.description:
Old Janx Spirit is a Decktet rummy game for 2 players.
Each player is dealt a hand of ten cards,the remaining cards become the draw pile.
On each turn draw one card and discard one card.
When all ten cards are part of melds the round ends and you score one point.

Link to wiki article: http://wiki.decktet.com/game:old-janx-spirit

64875.description:
Official Description:

It's the "Yahtzee Hands Down" Card Game! Keep your wits about you and your eye on the cards! Collect dice cards to make classic combinations - 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, small straight, full house and YAHTZEE! Re-roll by discarding cards you don't need and taking a chance on new ones! But here's the twist... pit your hand against another player's. Score high and win the Combo card points! Great Yahtzee fun in a card game!

Contents:

12 Combo Cards
12 Chance Cards
84 Dice Cards
1 Starter Card
1 Reminder Card
1 Combo Sheet
1 Set of Instructions
64875.name: Yahtzee Hands Down Card Game

64876.name: Oráculo
64876.description:
From the back of the book:

¡El único juego de rol donde dioses, humanos y monstruos pueden ser uno mismo!
Entra en la aventura del ORÁCULO de la mano de tu divinidad protectora; visita a Hades, señor de los infiernos; escucha a Atenea, diosa de la sabiduría; consigue el amor de Afrodita, la fuerza de Heraclio, los tesoros del rey Midas...
Reúne un grupo de amigos y podréis preparar una expedición a la Atlántida, ir a la guerra de Troya o enfrentaros al terrible Minotauro.
En la vertiente de la montaña sagrada del parnaso está el templo de Delfos y, junto a este, el ORÁCULO donde los dioses dictan el destino de los hombres.

64877.name: Flashpoint
64877.description: This game is played with a 32-card pack ranking AKQJ10987. A trick always consists of four card in four different suit, hence players have to play a card in a different suit or pass, and then one player can add more cards in the same trick. Tricks score for certain combinations, the first partnership to reach 100 points wins.

64880.name: Trafik-monopol
64880.description: A Swedish game where you move a traffic sign around a board, face traffic-based events and answer related questions. No one is very sure why traffic signs would need to know about these things. It's not a Monopoly clone but shares some minor visual elements, presumably in order to ride on Monopoly's popularity.

64881.name: Trafik-Snurran
64881.description: Swedish educational trivia game about traffic rules with a "magic robot"-style device for revealing the correct answers.

64882.name: Pirate Ship
64882.description:
From product description:
No point having a jungle island with adventures awaiting if you don’t have a ship to sail there, captain. And here she is, fully compatible with our other pirate story maps, three glorious decks of her(On deck, fore and aft castles and below deck). Is she a ship of Her Majesty’s navy, an armed merchantman of the Indies, or a freebooter in search of free booty? You decide. Crewed, boarded or mutinied, every corner is an encounter in the making thanks to the fantastic attention to detail in creating these maps.

Unlike some of our other story map sets, these tiles fit together in a non-random configuration, creating an entire ship for swashbuckling from prow to stern, deck to hold. In the above-water areas we provide a version that shows the sea, and a white-surround version to save you ink. Whatever you choose, she’s a fine vessel.

Pack contains: sixteen 8x8 inch high resolution full color tiles plus one layout sheet showing the whole ship and a bonus poster!

64884.name: IFGS Fantasy Rules (7th Edition)
64884.description:
From the back of the book:

The International Fantasy Gaming Society (IFGS) is a non-profit organization created to design and run live-scale, safe, outdoor fantasy games. Our system includes eight character classes and has mechanisms for fighting (with mock, padded weapons) and for casting spells. This book contains rules for fantasy games, along with information about how to contact the IFGS and design your own games. We invite you to join us in an exciting organization devoted to fantasy gaming.

64887.name: Golden Gate
64887.description:
Open up that Golden Gate! Its up to your wits, and a little bit of luck, to make the right plays and pile up the points.

Set down cards in number order. A yellow card means you take a chip out of the Golden Gate. Here’s where you show off your skills…can you place them at the right times to get the best chips? Or will the opportunity pass you by? And don’t get stuck with red cards, or you’ll lose chips.

It’s a fast, friendly showdown for the gold with the fine craftsmanship and colorful designs you’ve come to expect from Blue Orange Games.

64888.description:
How quick and precise are your fingers? Find out as you build piggy piles in this thrilling stacking game.
When two cards match, players race to construct a tower of piggies that is tops of the sty! Be careful! There are rules to how you can stack them. And your pile must stand up with the right number and color. Run out of cards and you are king of the pen.

Players will be on the edge of their seats and will take like pigs to mud as they shout "Pigzup!"
64888.name: PigzUp!

64890.name: PeekPoker
64890.description:
PeekPoker is a fast-paced and fun dice version of its cousin, Texas Hold’em Poker.

Players use 3 dice hidden inside their see-through cup and 3 community dice to make their combinations.

Think you’ve got a good hand? Make a bet and get the chance to snag your opponents’ chips. And beware of bluffers... they’ll fill you with doubt!

Make a bet and get the chance to snag your opponents’ chips.

64891.name: BattleBox 4th Edition
64891.description:
From the Publisher's Website:


Hundreds of diecut PC counters [including a ‘bloodied’ side!], dungeon dressings and cirular action tokens
Transparent spell effect sheets [acetate overlays]
20 plastic bases [10 white, 10 black] for use with the condition counters [dazed, deafened and 11 other conditions]
Pad of 4th edition character sheets.
Pad of power tracking sheets.
Dry-erase DM combat tracking sheet.
Dry-erase Player combat tracking sheet.
52 condition markers used with the INCLUDED 20 plastic bases [10 white and 10 black]. Mark combatants on the battlefield as deafened, prone, blind, dazed - 13 different conditions, 4 markers each
17x22 dry-erase battlemat
DRY-ERASE MARKER INCLUDED!

64893.name: Thalatha
64893.description:
A 2 player game play on a 3 by 3 grid. Each player has 3 stones and the object is to get 3 stones in a row (not diagonal.) Once a player has placed his three stones he moves one of his stones on his turn.

There is a note that comes with the game that says this game was taught to the publisher by an Iraqi boy while he was serving in Iraq. They played this game in the sand with stones. Part of the proceeds are donated to Operation Iraqi Children.

64894.name: Dragon (Issue 119 - Mar 1987)
rpgissuearticle: "Is There A Doctor in the Forest?"
64894.description:
Vol. XI No. 10 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art: Daniel Horne, our cover artist this month, was in the mood to do a historical
subject. His painting, entitled "The Real Reason the Romans left Britain," depicts a
little-known episode in British history, in which two Roman foot soldiers have
bumped into Kostchtchie, the surly fellow from page 40 of the Monster Manual II.
Of the unsquashed legionnaire, Daniel writes, "Boy, is he going to get it!"

This issue featured DRUIDS: Those Who Know Mother Nature Best - five articles on druids in AD&D.

64895.name: Kremlin: Destalinization Expansion
64895.description:
A 1953 variant for Kremlin posted in The General Vol.31,No.2. that included 5 new intrigue cards reflecting the political situation of the 1950's. This expansion was meant to be played with the basic Kremlin game and the "Revolution" expansion.

The cards and scenario in this set allow for picking up after Stalin leaves the scene.

64896.name: Formula D
64896.description:
This was the "mini" release of Ludodélire. It came with a non-mounted course of Monaco and shortened rules.

It differs from the "mini" version of Descartes Editeur (Formula Dé Mini) as well as from the new release of Asmodee (Formula D), which has the same name.

64897.description:
Formule Dé is a fast-paced racing game in which the cars' top speeds are limited by having to end a certain number of turns in each curve of the racetrack. This can be tricky, because although players can regulate their speeds by choosing which gear to be in and each gear allows a certain range of movement, the exact amount is determined randomly. Great fun for a big group.

The base game came with:

a d20 dice
Ten plastic cars (2 blue, 2 red, 2 white, 2 green, 2 yellow, one in each colour with a black heck spoiler)
one circuits 1&2 (Monaco, Hockenheim or Silverstone)
Rulebook
Racing sheets
Ten gear markers (2 blue, 2 red, 2 white, 2 green, 2 yellow)




This was the first release of a game of the family Formule Dé/Formula Dé/Formula D.

Formule Dé was released 1991 by Ludodélire. In 1997, the second release Formula De came from Descartes Editeur. And the newest release from Asmodee came in 2008.

Ludodélire published 13 courses for Formule Dé, 1 World Championchip expansion and a mini Variant (called Formula D).

Expanded by: (Ludodélire Expansions)

Formule Dé Circuit № 1: Grand Prix de MONACO (included in french edition)
Formule Dé Circuit № 2: FRANCE – Circuit de Nevers Magny-Cours
Formule Dé Circuit № 3: GRAN PREMO D'ITALIA – Autodromo Nazionale Monza
Formule Dé Circuit № 4: GROSSER PREIS VON DEUTSCHLAND – Hockenheim Ring (included in german edition)
Formule Dé Circuit № 5: GRAND PRIX DE BELGIQUE – Circuit de Spa – Francorchamps
Formule Dé Circuit № 6: GRANDE PREMIO DE PORTUGAL – Circuito do Estoril (included in portuguese edition)
Formule Dé Circuit № 7: BRITISH GRAND PRIX – Silverstone Circuit (included in british edition)
Formule Dé Circuit № 8: GRAN PREMIO DE ESPAÑA – Circuit de Catalunya
Formule Dé Circuit № 9: GRAND PRIX DU CANADA – Circuit Gilles Villeneuve
