Formule Dé Circuit № 10: GRANDE PREMIO DE BRASIL – Circuito do Interlagos
Formule Dé Circuit № 11: JAPAN GRAND PRIX – Suzuka Circuit
Formule Dé Circuit № 12: SOUTH of AFRICA GRAND PRIX – Kyalami Circuit
Formule Dé Circuit № 13: SAN MARINO – Autodromo Enzo & Dino Ferrari
Formule Dé: World Championship




Re-implemented by:

Formula Dé
Formula D
64897.name: Formule Dé

64898.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 48 - Mar 1999)
64898.description:
(user summary)
Issue 48 of the Wunderwelten magazine.
Contents:

editorial
news
DSA-news
shadowrun-news
battletech-news
book reviews
game reviews

battletech: infantery
crimson skies: preview
research - realism in roleplaying games
Armalion - new rules and scenario: Ruhe vor dem Orkensturm
Star Trek world tour: dilettantism and fraud on the USS Enterprise
shadowrun: Thiefs and booties
DSA: priests of Aventurien part 4: Peraine, Ingerimm, Rahja
Vampire: Children of the night

World of Darkness-scenario: Projekt Eos - Der Fluch der Mumie
DSA-Scenario: Boronmond

64899.name: Kayfabe
64899.description:
From the game introduction:

Ever watch a wrestling show and say to yourself "I can write a better storyline than that!" Well, now is your chance to prove it. Kayfabe draws you into the wrestling industry like no other game has before. Set up your own wrestling shows, while at the same time dealing with all the personal issues and drama that takes place behind the curtain. The premise behind Kayfabe is that you and the other players have set up your own independent wrestling promotion in hopes of one day rising to the top of the wrestling industry. Smart wrestling fans know that there is far more to the world of professional wrestling than two guys getting in the ring and beating each other up. There is a lot that goes on behind the scenes and in the ring that isn't apparent to the casual wrestling fan. Kayfabe takes into the account all of the behind the scenes intrigue, negotiating and drama that no one sees, as well as the actual wrestling we all watch on television. Players take on the roles of the writing staff and wrestlers throughout a series of televised shows and a climactic Pay Per View event.

64900.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 47 - Feb 1999)
64900.description:
(user summary)
Issue 47 of the Wunderwelten magazine.
Contents:

editorial
news
DSA-news
shadowrun-news
battletech-news
book reviews
game reviews

Shadowrun: The runners learn to run
Spiel 98: (game fair)
battletech: league system
Armalion: scenario "Die Kraft des Geistes"
board games
LARP: the 8. crusade

DSA: priests of Aventurien part 3: Firun, Tsa, Phex

Shadowrun-scenario: Die Stille Nacht
Earthdawn-scenario: Prospektor

64901.name: Piledrivers & Powerbombs (1st Edition)
64901.description:
From the game introduction:

Players take on the role of pro-wrestlers a short time before the biggest opportunity of their career. Each PC is embroiled in a bitter feud with their nemesis. PCs develop as they wrestle matches, ambush opponents and push their gimmicks. In order to succeed, the PCs need to band together to form a faction. Only when they have the strength of unity can they truly defeat their nemeses. Then the only obstacles to the WTF title belt are each other…

64902.name: Distant Signals
64902.description:
From the file's introduction

A hero finds a note and a set of truck keys in his pocket. The note instructs the heroes to locate a particular panel truck and deliver its cargo to a specified location. But where did the note come from, and what’s in the truck?

Distant Signals is an adventure that finds the heroes, wherever they may be. It is best used as a brief interlude between regular adventures in the campaign. The scenario outlines a task and describes those who oppose its completion. In addition, information is given about what “punishments” are levied against heroes who elect not to undertake the task at all.

A Short d20 Modern Adventure for Four 3rd-Level Characters

64903.name: Everything Goes
64903.description:
From the file's introduction

Some evil creatures are out to destroy the world; others just want to make a buck. The black market is cutthroat enough, but when supernatural and alien items are on the block, someone innocent always gets hurt.

A black marketeer named Bora Ghali has renovated an abandoned mine within a high mountain and turned it into the headquarters for her operations. So far, her organization has remained small, and no one has managed to procure much evidence against her. But all that is about to change. Can the heroes shut her down before her evil influence spreads all over the world?

A Short d20 Modern Adventure for Four 15th-Level Characters

64904.name: Faint Transmissions
64904.description:
From the file's introduction

A garbled, static-filled transmission in a foreign language emanates from a radio’s speakers and tells the heroes to stop a vehicle from crossing a certain set of railroad tracks. But where does this transmission come from, and why can’t anyone else hear it?

Faint Transmissions is an adventure that finds the heroes, wherever they may be. It is best used as a brief interlude between regular adventures in the campaign. The scenario outlines a task and describes those who oppose its completion. In addition, information is given about what “punishments” are levied against heroes who elect not to undertake the task at all.

A Short d20 Modern Adventure for Four 2nd-Level Characters

64905.name: Far Voices
64905.description:
From the file's introduction

Far Voices is an adventure that finds the heroes. Garbled, static-filled transmissions in a foreign language coming from a car’s speakers tell a hero to acquire a hot electronic toy. This adventure outlines a task and its opposition, and it covers what happens if the hero does not undertake the task.

Far Voices is a short adventure for 1st-level heroes using the d20 Modern Roleplaying Game

64906.name: Flames of Wrath
64906.description:
From the file's introduction

There are those who hold that whatever evil you do eventually comes back to you, in either this life or the next. And when your crime is particularly heinous, retribution can take highly unusual forms—perhaps even supernatural ones.

TEAM BRAVO: Flames of Wrath is an adventure set in the modern day, but it includes fantastic elements such as undead creatures with supernatural powers.

A Short Adventure for Four 4th-Level Heroes

64907.name: Foul Weather
64907.description:
From the file's introduction

From radiation and black holes to meteorites and cosmic rays, the threats of the cosmos easily trump those of even the harshest terrestrial wilderness. Two derelict spacecraft orbiting a planet on the fringe of known space pay silent homage to the fragility of human life and the raw, devastating power of space. For the past two years, the I.S.S. Beagle and End’s Run have orbited this planet, locked together in a grim dance of death. Can the heroes unlock the secret of their destruction without falling victim to the same fate?

A short d20 Future adventure for four 5th-level characters.

64908.name: Crisis on Canyon Road
64908.description:
From the file's introduction

In real life, heroes are often ordinary people who find themselves in extraordinary situations, such as aiding accident victims, dealing with the aftermath of a calamity, or rescuing children in danger. When they see others in trouble or need, they step in and offer assistance with no thought of reward or gain. It is this kind of selfless action that earns them the title of hero.

This sort of heroism is sometimes forgotten in a d20 MODERN campaign, where threats often come in the form of overwhelming foes or supernatural forces. In situations such as these, heroes are by necessity adventurers—well-equipped, highly trained individuals who seek out action, mystery, and most of all danger in many exotic forms.

Crisis on Canyon Road allows the heroes to test their mettle in a more mundane way. It places them in a situation that any ordinary person might face— namely, happening upon the aftermath of an automobile accident on a remote road. Although they are likely to uncover one or two surprises along the way, the main question is whether or not the characters have what it takes to be real heroes.

A Short d20 Modern Adventure for Four 17th-Level Characters

64909.name: No Man's Land
64909.description:
From the file's introduction

They say that those who do not learn from history are doomed to repeat it. Thus, it would seem that educating the public about past military conflicts would help to ensure peace. But one patron has a different purpose in mind for the new museum exhibit on World War I trench warfare. To him, a historical recreation of the War to End All Wars simply isn’t complete without massive casualties.

No Man’s Land is an adventure set in the modern day, but it includes fantastic elements such as undead creatures and black magic.

A Short Adventure for Four 3rd-Level Characters

64910.name: The Petersen Counterstrike
64910.description:
From the file's introduction

The world is an unsafe place. We all know it. With the rise of modern terrorist tactics, it seems like no place is safe—anything can happen to anyone, anywhere, at any time. We all feel more secure and comfortable in our own homes than elsewhere, but in reality, home offers little more protection than the office, the mall, or any other public place. In fact, for those involved in high-security work, home is sometimes the weakest link in the chain of personal protection.

In The Petersen Counterstrike, a terrorist organization strikes at Department-7 by targeting the home of one of its employees.

64911.name: Resolutions
64911.description:
From the file's introduction

Sages and philosophers often note that the end of any endeavor is simultaneously the beginning of another. How fitting, then, that the word “resolution” can refer to both endings and beginnings. Some use this word to talk about the conclusion of a period of time, such as the end of a calendar year. Others use it to discuss plans for what lies ahead, such as the personal goals people often set for themselves at the start of a new year.

This principle of duality is starkly evident in any court of law. A hearing or trial is the conclusion of a particular series of events, and the verdict determines whether closure has been achieved or renewed reflection is necessary. At the same time, the trial is the beginning of the defendant’s new life as a convicted felon or a free person.

Resolutions puts the heroes in a courtroom for the trial of Audrey Petersen, who stands accused of complicity in several homicides and crimes resulting in millions of dollars of property damage. But will they have the resolution to ensure that justice is served?

A Short Urban Arcana Adventure for Four 13th-Level Characters

64912.name: Sagebrush Horror
64912.description:
From the file's introduction

America’s wild west was a land of fast guns and quick death. Wild animals ran rampant, killing both cattle and humans. But are the recent deaths in the town of Sagebrush really due to wolves and wildcats, or does a more insidious menace stalk this small western town?

A Short d20 Past Adventure for Four 7th-Level Heroes.

64913.name: System Error
64913.description:
From the file's introduction

The threat of sentient machines has long been the stuff of science fiction, action, and even horror movies. But what if such art forms are merely reflections of real events that the rise of Shadow has brought forth?

In TEAM BRAVO: System Error, a computer not only develops self-awareness, it also gains the ability to cast spells and perform incantations. Can the heroes stop this machine before it acquires even more arcane knowledge?

64914.name: The First Assignment
64914.description:
User summary

The First Assignment is a short d20 Modern adventure for four 2nd-level player characters. They are part of Team Bravo, a police special investigations division. Their first mission is to check out an odd report of gang violence, but the mutilated body they find at the crime scene will lead them to a scientific experiment gone horribly wrong.

64915.name: The Final Feast
64915.description:
From the file's introduction

A feast—is there any better or more universal way to memorialize an important affair? No matter what event is being commemorated, nothing brings people together like copious amounts of food, drink, and conversation.

The Final Feast takes place on Thanksgiving Day in a major U.S. city. A group of fanatical cultists uses an arcane ritual to transform homeless people partaking of a local food bank’s holiday feast into ravenous monsters with insatiable appetites.

A Short Urban Arcana Adventure for Four 11th-Level Characters

64916.name: Too Far Gone
64916.description:
From the file's introduction

Evil takes many forms, and not all of them are human. Could the reports of monsters on the remote Pacific island of Kongauru be more than the deranged stories of crackpots and rumormongers? No one seems to be interested in investigating, since no government claims the island and it is of no commercial value. But someone must, before the evil brewing there erupts full-force upon the world.

A Short d20 Modern Adventure for Four 16th-Level Characters

64917.name: Ganderpoke
64917.description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards (including jokers and/or removing cards, depending on the number of players). 25 cards are put face-down on the table, forming a 5x5 square. A player in his turn takes any face-down card from the square, adds it to his hand, and fill the gap with any card from his hand face up.

When all the cards in the square are face up, the value of the square counted according to the Poker combinations in the rows and columns. Then each player chooses five cards from his hand; the player with the best Poker combination scores twice the value of the square, the player with the worst Poker combination scores the value of the square.

64918.name: Touch of Death
64918.description:
From the file's introduction

With the influx of Shadow into our world, musty tomes and relics imbued with mystic powers are beginning to surface everywhere. Many who desire power above all else go to great pains to find and use such items, regardless of the cost.

One self-taught Mage employed such a relic—a book of dark and arcane lore—to learn the secret of creating constructs from dead human flesh. Though he was able to meet most of his needs with the bounty of dead flesh stored at the local morgue, he discovered that certain body parts had to meet particular specifications, and murder was the best way to obtain those. So he launched a killing spree that lasted until one of his would-be victims turned the tables and slew him. Now that his creations are free, they will continue to act on his last commands until they too are stopped once and for all.

TEAM BRAVO: Touch of Death is an adventure set in the modern era, but it includes fantastic elements such as dark magic and blasphemous creations.

A Short Adventure for Four 6th-Level Heroes

64919.name: Galapagos
64919.description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards. The game consists of three phases as follows:

1. Melds. In Phase 1 you both try to improve your hands by bidding for new cards from the stock. When none remain in stock, you score for any melds (card combinations) contained in your revised hands. This phase is rather like Gops.

2. Tricks. In Phase 2 you play out your revised hands to 13 tricks, aiming especially to win an odd number of tricks (1, 3, 5 etc). This phase is rather like Piquet.

3. Play-off. Finally, you each pick up as a new hand the 13 cards you used for bidding in the first phase, and aim to be the first to play out all the cards from your hand. This phase is rather like Arsehole / President / Trouduc.

64920.name: Non Player Compendium - Volume One
64920.description:
User summary

This book contains statistics and background descriptions for five NPCs:


Nelvax Mentosan - Half-elf Aristocrat/Rogue (CR 6)
Regdig Bloodstriker - Dwarven Fighter (CR 12)
Jelrith Perl - Human sorcerer (CR 4)
Fehlanna Tem'Prash - Elf Warrior/Cleric (CR 17)
Adim Protiye - Human Bard/Explorer (CR 1)

64921.name: Hamlet
64921.description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards stripped down to AKQJT987 plus one Joker. Eleven tricks are played, hence one player will win either the middling number of tricks, or, if two win the same number, a unique number of tricks. That player is designated Hamlet. A new trump suit and a scoring multiplier (whether it is more desirable "to be or not to be" Hamlet) are decided at the start of each round.

More information can be found at http://www.davidparlett.co.uk/oricards/hamlet.html

64922.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 46 - Nov 1998)
64922.description:
(user summary)
Issue 46 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
DSA-news
battletech-news
book reviews
game reviews

DSA - fanzines
shadowrun - death of a megacon
Armalion - campaign: Die Saga von Thorescha
painting advice
CoC - away from the usual
classic boardgames

DSA: priests of Aventurien part 2: Travia, Boron, Hesinde

Shadowrun-scenario: Im Netz der Spinne
Call of Cthulhu-Scenario: Das Erbe der Bittersteins
DSA-scenario: Das unheilige Kind

64923.name: Dreamscapes
64923.description:
From the file's introduction

Dreamscapes is a book intended for people who wish to add a surrealistic quality to their fantasy roleplaying games with a minimum of new rules to read through and learn. This book expands upon the material presented within the PHB, DMG, and MM; from character races, classes, skills, feats, equipment, and spells to how to run a surrealistic campaign and what monsters might lurk within a Dream Plane. Experienced players and GMs will find the information laid out in a manner familiar to them, while beginners should have time to digest the rules and terminology within the PHB before attempting to add the rules found herein to their campaign

64924.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 45 - Sep 1998)
64924.description:
(user summary)
Issue 46 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
DSA-news
battletech-news
book reviews
game reviews

Armalion: preview of the new tabletop game
Shadowrun: preview of 3rd edition
earthdawn: travel
dragonlance: interview with Magaret Weis and Don Peppin

DSA: priests of Aventurien part 1: Praios, Rondra, Efferd
Shadowrun: dangerous secrets
Star Trek: The Triangel, part 2

DSA-scenario: Die letzten Tage ds Sommers
Shadowrun-scenario: Trügerischer Frieden

64925.name: Hot Pursuit
64925.description:
User summary

Hot Pursuit presents rules for chases using the d20 System. It encompasses chases on mounts, carriages, cars, motorcycles, aircraft, and water vehicles. Included are rules for range, speed, and terrain, obstacles and maneuvers, as well as gm advice for preparing and running a chase.

64926.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 44 - Jul 1998)
64926.description:
(user summary)
Issue 44 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
DSA-news
battletech-news
book reviews
game reviews

DSA: music of Aventurien
shadowrun: dangerous secrets part1: fight of a megacon an a duchy
battletech: campaigns
earthdawn: mermaids
middle earth: J.R.R. Tolkien
Star Trek: The Triangel, part 1

Vampire-scnario: Noctes Irae
DSA-Scenario: Ein Wald von Stahl und Fleisch
Earthdawn-scanrio: Die letzte Prüfung

64927.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 42 - Mar 1998)
64927.description:
(user summary)
Issue 42 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
DSA-news
battletech-news
book reviews
game reviews

shadowrun: pirates of the North Sea
deadlands: review
earthdawn: shamans
battlespace: rules & scenario
DSA: Daughter of the Swan

secret societies
Jarandell, Garden of wizards, part 3

DSA-scenario: Oblarasim
Shadowrun-scenario: Auf Kaperfahrt

64928.name: The Order of the Gilded Rose
64928.description:
User summary

The Order of the Gilded Rose mainly presents members of the order which is some kind of secret organization that infiltrates evil courts, demon cults, etc. The order itself is only described briefly.

64929.name: Pirit - Den innersta kretsen
64929.description:
Translation from back of book:

"Pirit - Den innersta kretsen" is a campaign and adventure module for "Mutant - Undergångens arvtagare". Among others you will find inside:

- 196 full pages dealing with the southern Pyrisamfundet, especially the gangster-ruled city of Pirit situated between the Vättaträsket and life-threatening Frihetens Slätter.

- A couple of full-page color images, giving more life to the setting

- Rules for vehicles, including rules on how to build and modify your own vehicle

- Detailed maps of the cities of Pirit, Muntermåla, Hugahult and other places of adventure

- 5 new creatures, from the feared Levergöken to the playable reptile men, living in the depths of the Vättaträsket

64930.name: Fantasy Occupations
64930.description:
From the file's introduction

Fantasy Occupations is a d20 resource designed to help players and Dungeon Masters flesh out the backgrounds of 1st level fantasy characters, providing them with a skill set that will follow them throughout their entire adventuring career.

64931.name: Character Drawbacks
64931.description:
From the file's introduction

One of the more interesting innovations in the d20 system is the concept of Feats. While any two fighters or wizards will look more or less the same in class abilities and skills, it is their Feats that differentiate them. One fighter might use his Feat slots to become more skilled in mounted combat, while another might strive to be an excellent archer. Even at low levels, these two fighters will look and act very differently in combat.

In literature and popular culture, characters are often just as, if not more, defined by their faults than their abilities. Othello was gullible, and this enabled Iago to manipulate him. Han Solo was notable for his mercenary attitude. Captain Hook is remembered for... well, his hook. These faults, or drawbacks, lend color to the characters that have them. This d20 MasterKit product is designed to add these drawbacks to player characters.

64932.name: Waba: 4 Denk – Und Legespiele
64932.description:
WABA
The players try to connect opposing sides of the gameboard. There's a two player and a three player version. Two players each have 40 pieces, three players each have 30 pieces.
The first move for each player is to place a piece on the startline. From that position a continuous line is to be formed. After the first move players may place a piece on every field on the board that is unoccupied by a piece of the adversaries.
When all pieces have been played and no line connecting the opposing sides of the board is formed, the game ends in a draw.

WABEN-HALMA
Waben-Halma is a two player game. Each has 15 pieces to be placed in the 'Waben-triangle' at the base of the board. The object is to be the first player to have moved all 15 pieces in the starttriangle of the opponent. The rules of this game are exactly like Halma.

DREIER-WABEN
This is a game for two or three players. Each players has 15 pieces. Every turn one piece is to be placed on the board. The object is to be the player who has formed the largest number of triangle formations on the board. Such triangle formations contain three pieces of the same colour in pyramid form.

WABEN-BILDER
Waben-Bilder is a game of shape building. Each player tries to form a certain figure (a flower, house, key etc.) on the board. The first to complete such a figure wins the game.

64933.name: One Million Magic Items
64933.description:
User summary

One Million Magic Items presents three d100 tables to quickly create magic items. One table provides the item's name prefix, one the basic item type, and one an item's name suffix. Each name prefix and suffix gives the item special powers.


=Example item

Beryl Repeating Crossbow of Woe - A cursed crossbow granting one additional 1st and 2nd level spell slot per day but imposes a -2 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws and skill checks.

64934.name: Random Fantasy Adventure Generator
64934.description:
From the file's introduction

This generator is intended as a tool that gives a Game Master the bare outline of an adventure. A quick series of die rolls will give you the basic theme of an adventure, which can then by be tailored for your specific campaign style.

64936.name: Monster Modifier
64936.description:
User summary

Monster Modifier is a set of random tables that allows the GM to modify his monsters with some new quirks to make them more interesting and keep the players off balance when they use standard tactics to battle seemingly standard monsters.

64937.name: The Castle Perilous
64937.description:
User summary - An RPG system published in the early days of the hobby. Based on the use of three D6 dice for resolution. For those who don't have enough 6 sided dice, a table of random numbers is included.

This books contains the complete rules and two sample adventures.

64941.name: Dave Dawson Pacific Battle Game
64941.description: Dave Dawson was the lead character in a number of books, called "The War Adventure Series" written by Robert Sidney Brown from 1942 - 1946. A couple of those books were converted to board games. This is one of those games and is based on the story in the book "Dave Dawson with the Pacific Fleet"

64942.name: Dave Dawson Victory Game
64942.description: Dave Dawson was the lead character in a number of books, called "The War Adventure Series" written by Robert Sidney Brown from 1942 - 1946. A couple of those books were converted to board games. This is one of those games and is based on the story in the book "Dave Dawson with the Commandos"

64943.name: Foe Factory: Modern
64943.description:
From the file's introduction

Foe Factory: Modern allows GMs to quickly create entertaining and interactive NPCs for their d20 Modern-based games and to rapidly scale those NPCs to challenge Player Characters of any level; without having to rewrite them from the ground up. NPCs created with Foe Factory differ from normal ancillary characters in a few fundamental areas while maintaining essential playability and quick statistical recognition. Mostly, this involves changes to how the NPC’s stat block is presented, how NPC ability scores are generated, and how NPCs gain special attributes.

64945.name: The Original Home Jai-Alai Game
64945.description: Only game published by Design Origin, done in 1984 and of course based on the game of Jai-Alai known as the fastest sport in the world.

64946.name: Reality Check
64946.description:
From the file's introduction

A young reporter has gone missing while investigating a strange industrial facility in the wilderness. What happened to her, and what does the mysterious company called UberCorp have to do with her disappearance?

Reality Check is the first in a series of adventures known as the Project Javelin Campaign. This scenario requires no specific location, though the setting should be close to a mountain range and a medium to- large city.

A Short d20 Modern Adventure for Four 1st-Level Characters

64947.name: Miracles & Wonders
64947.description:
User summary

Miracles & Wonders offers a replacement for the divine spellcasting system of the d20 main rules. Instead of having a specific set of spells, divine characters call upon their deity when they need a miracle at the moment they need it. The game master decides if the miracle is granted and what results it will have based upon the character's reserve of divine grace, their success at invocation, his/her hubris and the kind of miracle that was asked for.

64948.name: Non Player Compendium - Volume Two
64948.description:
User summary

This volume of the Non Player Compendium focuses on a single NPC who is given stats for levels 1, 5, 10, 15, and 20. Levels 10 to 20 are developed with two different possible backgrounds, one good and one evil.

The character in this volume is Caius, an elven bard, who turns either either into a vampire, or into a good Bard/Cleric.

64949.name: Hamburger Cardgame
64949.description:
Players get 6 cards and must create hamburgers with more points than opponents. Every turn they may change 1 card and must open 1 component in front of them. If all hamburgers are completed scoring takes place and player with the most points is winner.

Components:
52 cards

64950.name: Expert Feats
64950.description:
User summary

Expert Feats is a set of five NPC feats that should make them more valuable as experts in their profession to be hired by the player characters.

64951.name: Temporary Enchantment
64951.description:
User summary

Temporary Enchantment contains four spells for arcane and divine spellcasters that lets them temporarily enchant their comrades weapons to make a weapon more effective against a certain type of foe. These spells are meant especially to make allow fighters fighters to damage the enemies if their weaponry is otherwise not sufficient to deal damage.

64952.name: Skillful Stunts
64952.description:
User summary

Skillful Stunts introduces the stunt check mechanic. If a character performs a stunt in combat and makes a successful stunt check, he gains one or more stunt point that he can use to add special effects to his action (like increased damage, lowered enemy AC, etc.). Stunts become more difficult against the same foe as the enemy learns the tricks of the character.

64953.name: The Dread Codex
64953.description:
User summary

The Dread Codex is a collection of monsters, spells, and magic items that are all related to the undead.

Included are:

71 monsters
6 monster templates
28 magic items and
2 minor and one major artifacts
2 magic materials
8 armor and weapon qualities
72 spells

64954.name: Dread Codex 2: The Necromancer's Tome
64954.description:
User summary

Dread Codex 2 is a collection of spells, prestige classes, monsters, NPCs, and magic items that are all related to the undead.

Included are:

29 spells
4 prestige classes
7 magic items
4 artifacts
4 monsters
3 NPCs
1 monster template

64955.description:
You are teaching witches how to fly at Blocksberger Flugschule. Only the most talented witches are admitted there.

You have to let five witches fly as high and far as possible. Every witch that succeeds will give you a spellbook. The player with the most spellbooks wins.
64955.name: Hexenflug

boardgamehonor: 2010 Årets Spill Best Family Game Nominee
64956.description:
The Unpredictable Game of Making Connections

Gather your sunglasses, snowshoes and mosquito spray - it’s time to travel to new destinations with the 10 Days Series - the Americas!

Players use destination and transportation tiles to chart a course through North, Central and South America and the Caribbean - touring by airplane, cruise ship or on foot. With a little luck and clever planning, you just might outmaneuver your fellow travelers and be the first to make connections for a complete ten day journey!

Gameplay
Players begin by filling their tile holders, drawing and placing tiles into 10 spaces. Each space is a day of a player's trip. Each tile shows a country, a plane, or a ship. Tiles are drawn and placed one at a time, and cannot be moved once placed. Once all players' holders are full, a face-down draw pile is made of the remaining tiles, as well as three face-up discard piles. On his or her turn, a player either takes a face-down tile from the draw pile, or a face-up tile from the top of a discard pile. He or she then decides whether to exchange the new tile with an old one. The tile not being kept is then discarded.
Players are attempting to have all 10 days of their trip connect, either by foot, by plane, or by ship. To connect by foot, countries must be adjacent or connected. To connect by plane, a plane of a certain color must be placed between two countries of the same color. To connect by ship, the ship must be placed between countries adjacent to that ocean/sea (or one ship can connect to another). The first person to build a fully connected trip wins.
Contains:
40 destination tiles
23 transportation tiles
8 tile holders
Map game board
Rules
64956.name: 10 Days in the Americas
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 87 - Family Games, Part 2 - The Adventurers, Forbidden Island and 10 Days in the Americas

64957.name: Flip-'n-Stack Tiki Island
64957.description:
Game consists of a metal, two-sided board; a teeter-totter launching platform; and 6 little Tiki statue figures -- 3 blue and 3 green -- each with strong magnets in their hands and feet. The blue and green figures are of opposite polarity.

Play is simple:
1. Place tiki on launcher.
2. Place launcher close to the metal board.
3. Place finger on launcher and press.

The figure flips into the air and hopefully lands on the the board. The magnets are strong enough that generally the tiki will right itself vertically (either right-side up or upside down). You alternate colors in hopes of forming a stack of figures.

Score is based on where the figures land on the island depicted on the board and how high the stacks are.

The reverse side of the board contains a dartboard-like target.

64959.name: Last Battle for Germany
64959.description:
From publisher's website:
In 1989, the governments of eastern Europe fell leading to an end of the Warsaw Pact. The Soviet leadership surrendered to the political and economic realities they faced. Events could have been different. Last Battle for Germany is a simulation of a military climax of the Cold War. The game is played against a backdrop of unknown political and military events over which the players have no control, but to which they must react. Players maneuver their divisions, brigade and regiments across a map with 15 kms per hex during turns representing 48 hour. An innovative game system represents each subordinate commander's headquarters and support assets. An integrated air game completes this definitive simulation of a Warsaw Pact-NATO conflict.

64960.name: TriForce
64960.description:
From publisher's website:
TriForce is an innovative strategy game offers wargaming in an exciting science-fiction format. Move one-inch playing pieces containing futuristic forces to capture key areas of the board. Combat is resolved with a unique dice roll system. The board features oversized hexagons with dramatic colors instead of terrain. All of the basic wargaming concepts are here in a game you can play with anyone.

64961.name: Dragon (Issue 122 - Jun 1987)
rpgissuearticle: ...And a Step Beyond That: The designer's new list of Oriental references
A Big Book of Little Heroes: A special book review with a miniature focus
Leader of the Pack: Leadership abilities in the STAR FRONTIERS game
Marshalling the Martial Arts: Twelve martial arts styles for Oriental characters
Out of Africa: Supernatural creatures from the dark continent
The Spy Game That Came in From the Cold
A Step Beyond Shogun...: A reader's guide to adventuring in the Orient
The Ecology of the Rot Grub: A brief lecture not easily forgotten
The GM's Ten Commandments: Ten dos and don'ts for game masters everywhere
The Natural Order: Yet more spells for druids everywhere
The Role of Computers: A world above all worlds
The Ultimate Addenda: Fixing super-powers in the Advanced MARVEL SUPER HEROES game
64961.description:
Vol. XII No. 1 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art: We wanted to set our 11th anniversary issue off with a bang, but we had no idea that Denis Beauvais's cover would literally set the issue on fire. Denis wrote that he sketched over 40 dragons before settling on this one, which we like to think of as our hallmark. As the convention button says: THE LIGHT AT THE END OF THE TUNNEL MAY BE AN ONCOMING DRAGON. (from the contents page)

This issue featured:
African Beasts and Monsters
Druids and Martial Arts
Lunar Espionage

It also listed the "Gamers' Guide," which was an index of all the advertising in the issue and "TSR Previews," a list of upcoming products from TSR.

64962.name: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
64962.description: Invasion of the Body Snatchers is a party game for 8-21 players based off of the popular Mafia and Werewolf games. One of the players is secretly an alien invader in a human body and is turning the citizens of Lake Terror into pod people one by one. Can the town find and lynch the alien menace before it's too late? It won't be easy, but you will have fun finding out.

64963.name: Hot Pursuit: On Foot
64963.description:
User summary

Hot Pursuit: On Foot is an addition to the chase rules presented in Hot Pursuit, adding rules for chases on foot. It includes new obstacles and maneuvres.

64964.name: Memini
64964.description:
This game is played with two standard decks of cards. One of them is dealt to the players evenly (the remaining cards remain face down). Then everyone has half minute to memorize his cards. Then the cards from the other pack are revealed one at a time, and players can claim they have the matching pair among their cards.

After going through the deck every player scores 1 point for his card if he card alone claimed it, and p points if it was claimed by someone else as well, where p is the number of players.

64965.name: The Safety Belt Game
64965.description:
Published by the U.S. Department of Transportation to promote the use of seat belts. Each player rolls a die and moves along a track. the first player to get the amusement park wins.

Some spaces are marked with hazards that cause the loss of a turn. Other spaces cause the player to get out the car. When movement resumes, a Safety Belt card must be drawn. If the player forgets to do this, a turn is lost. There are two exits, which if landed on, can shorten the trip.

It is a game for children who don't mind being preached to while playing.

64966.name: Dragon (Issue 125 - Sep 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Armies From the Ground Up: Taxes, politics, immigrants, and the military in AD&D games
Bazaar of the Bizarre: The Magical Maps of Greyhawk
Clay-O-Rama: A miniatures melodrama for all ages
Glory, Danger, and Wounds: Cavaliers and their pursuit of honor
Lords & Legends: Three lords from the Age of Chivalry
Meanwhile, Back at the Fief...: Feudal lords have a lot to keep them busy
Role-Playing Reviews: A look at three fantasy adventures
A Second Look at Zebulon's Guide: Corrections, clarifications, additions, and answers
The Best for the Best: Elite espionage agencies for TOP SECRET games
The Code of Chivalry: Orders of Knighthood in  the AD&D game
The Ecology of the Greenhag: One of a broad and evil family of hags
The Game Wizards: A book of kender, knights, and Krynn
The Marvel-Phile: From Abomination to Zzzax
The Role of Books: Alternate and alien worlds galore
Woodlands of the Realms: Magical and mundane forests for FORGOTTEN REALMS campaigns
64966.description:
Vol. XII No. 4 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art: A Camlan burns in the background, a wounded King Arthur prepares to meet the mounted attack of his hated rival Mordred. This painting was carefully researched by Roger Raupp, who based the weapons, armor, and fortifications on those in existence in the British Isles after A.D. 500. The battle shown here takes place at Hadrian's Wall, where some sources believe the historical Arthur lived. (from the contents page)

This issue featured CHIVALRY - 5 articles on Feudal lords, armored knights, brave deeds, and glory; CLAY-0-RAMA - An incredibly off-beat miniatures game for all ages; and the center of this issue featured a GAMMARAUDERS poster.
.It also listed the "Gamers' Guide," which was an index of all the advertising in the issue and "TSR Previews," a list of upcoming products from TSR.
Wormy artist David Trampier was erroneously listed as "David Rampier" in the artist credits.

64967.name: The Bloodfangs
64967.description:
User summaries

This volume of the Hordes series describes The Bloodfangs, a band of half-orc marauders.

It covers the following topics:

History
Culture
Dress & equipment
Tactics
Religion & rituals
The Bloody Ravager prestige class
Important NPCs

64968.name: The Thunderfist
64968.description:
User summary

This volume of the Hordes series describes The Thunderfist, a tribe of barbarian survivors from an ancient fallen Dwarven kingdom.

It covers the following topics:

History
Culture
Dress & equipment
Tactics
Religion & rituals
The Warrior Smith prestige class
Important NPCs

64969.name: The Horse-Masher
64969.description:
User summaries

This volume of the Hordes series describes the Horse-Masher tribe, nomadic riders of the plains.

It covers the following topics:

History
Culture
Dress & equipment
Tactics
Religion & rituals
The Horse Lord prestige class
Important NPCs

64970.name: Minimisere
64970.description:
This game is played with a part of a standard deck of cards. Depending on the number of players, some cards are removed. Then tricks are played. The uniqueness of the game is that the score depends on the number of tricks won in a strange way. For example with five players there are five tricks, and the score is 1 for winning 1 trick, 2 for 2 tricks, 5 for 0 tricks, 6 for 3 tricks, 8 for 4 tricks and 0 for 5 tricks.

More information can be found at http://www.davidparlett.co.uk/oricards/minimis.html

64971.name: Knife
64971.description:
User summary

This volume of the The Sharp End series details the knife weapon type. It gives an overview of laws ruling possession and of knives in modern and future settings, presents different knife variants with descriptions and game statistics, and offers rules for concealing and detecting knives. It also adds knife-related feats and some magical knives.

64972.name: Chaos Earth Sourcebook: Creatures of Chaos
64972.description:
From the Publisher:


Creatures of Chaos is jam-packed with unearthly creatures that represent the menacing and the bizarre, the mischevious and the maniacal. Some are supernatural hellspawn, others are just plain weird, all are dangerous. Dozens of demons and monsters specific to the Apocalyptic setting. All new.
More on NEMA and how they respond to the Demon Plagues.
Human pawns and madmen who serve supernatural evil.
Background setting, missions and adventure ideas galore.

64973.name: Sword
64973.description:
User summary

This volume of the The Sharp End series details the sword weapon type. It presents various sword variants, sword-related feats, six prestige classes, and Sköfnung, an artifact sword, based on the sword sword of the Danish king Hrólf Kraki. It also has an appendix with the Code Duello, a set of historic dueling rules, pirate duel and prizefight rules as well as stage gladiator match rules.

64974.name: Dragon (Issue 129 - Jan 1988)
rpgissuearticle: "Who's in Charge Here?": "Pyramid power" and leadership in the AD&D game
Arcane Lore: Magic of the Dwarven Priests
Children of the Spider Goddess: The darkest elves' point of view
Don't Sell Them Short! Halfling Guardians: Defenders of the small folk
Entering the Drider's Web: What happens after a drow fails Lolth's test
Give Demi-humans an Even Break! More dice are nice when rolling ability scores
Role-Playing Reviews: All the world's a dungeon
A Sorcerer's Supplement: New sorcery spells for RUNEQUEST game wizards
The Dragon's Bestiary: Colder than ice
The Game Wizards: A volume of Oerthly delights
The Last Word: Adventurers say the darndest things before you squash them
The Role of Books: An SCA mystery, wargamers as duelists, and rock-&-roll magic
The Role of Computers: Naval warfare and tower adventures
64974.description:
Vol. XII No. 8 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art: While their cleric of Thor stands guard, a group of dwarves hauls out (or hides away) their massive chest of treasure. "These guys," said cover artist Keith Parkinson, indicating the dwarves holding the chest, "are basically 'greed dwarves.'" Entitled "The Big Stash," this painting will soon be available as a print. Keith recently won the coveted 1987 Dark Fantasy award at the World Fantasy Convention in Nashville, for his painting "What do You Mean, We're Lost?" (from the contents page)

This issue featured Demi-humans: Pointed ears aren't the only things that make them different. - 5 articles from the nonhuman perspective.

It also listed the "Gamers' Guide," which was an index of all the advertising in the issue.

64976.name: Dragon (Issue 249 - Jul 1998)
rpgissuearticle: Arcane Lore - The Lost Spellbook of Rary the Traitor
Bazaar of the Bizarre - A Traveler's Emporium
Giants of the Earth - The Waterborn
Out of Character - Simplifying THAC0 and Armor Class
64976.description:
Historical Fantasy

Vol. XXIII, No. 2
Cover art by Tony Sazudlo

64977.name: Dragon (Issue 196 - Aug 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Bazaar of the Bizarre - New Figurines of Wondrous Power
Cultivating Campaign Cultures - Soceities Should Have Character, Too!
Editorial - A Little Bob in all of Us
Novel Ideas - Days of Future Passed
Put Some Action Into Your Campaign!
Role-Playing Reviews - Do Novels and Movies Make For Good Games?
The Art of Storytelling - The GM's Challenge

64979.name: Landsraad
64979.description:
From the rulebook:

"Intrigue, trade and war in the Dune universe."

"Dune's universe, between the advent of Muad'Dib. Political, economic and military struggle between the Noble Houses of the Imperium. Meddle in politics during the Landsraad Council, influencing the Padishah Emperor. Acquire wealth, speculating on Semuta Drug and Pundi Rice prices in the CHOAM. Plan hostile actions against rivals, under the limitations of the Great Convention."

Components:

"The game is conducted on 3 boards: on the LANDSRAAD board you can plan political actions; on the CHOAM board you can trade resources for SOLARI (the Imperium currency); on the KANLY board you can plan assassinations, sabotage actions, or even full-scale wars."

"Tokens represent commodities (SPICE MELANGE, HAGAL QUARTZ, etc.), or SOLARI (the Imperium currency). Also, there are tokens to represent three NOBLES for each Noble House, and for their soldiers (TROOPERS, SABOTEURS and ASSASSINS). Also there are tokens to represent the special ADVISORS (Mentat or Bene Gesserit) which you could be provided if you met the Emperor's favour."

"Cards represent useful situations which could help you during your quest for power. The most powerful ones are you cannot obtain by chance: they are PETITIONS to the Padishah Emperor which he has graciously agreed to concede (or, sometimes, not to concede). Less powerful situations are just acts of FATE."

Gameplay summary:

"Each player will represent a Noble House and will be given three NOBLE tokens: he will use those tokens to attempt actions in each turn. Actions could be political (LANDSRAAD board), trade (CHOAM board) or hostile (KANLY board): to represent that a player is attempting an action, he will put one of his NOBLE in the appropriate slot on the appropriate board. The number of action a player could do in a turn will be therefore generally limited by the NOBLE tokens he has, even if it will be possible to increase it by mean of ADVISORS."

"Each turn is divided in three phases: LANDSRAAD, CHOAM and KANLY; each to be played on the appropriate board."

Victory:

"When a player will draw the End Game Fate Card, he will immediately show it, and the game will end. The Noble house with the most SOLARI will win the game."

64980.name: ArchCriminal
64980.description:
From the rulebook:

"Ever wondered what is it like to be a Super Evil Villain Mastermind attempting to take over the world, scheming twisted plots in his Hidden Lair? Now you can be one."

"In order to win the game you have to CONQUER THE WORLD!!!! BWHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!!!!!!! At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt three Objective Cards at random, which are to be kept secret. In order to CONQUER THE WORLD!!!! you have to fulfil your three objectives."

In this tongue-in-cheek game, the players are evil super-villains operating from secret lairs scattered around the globe. The players send out their lowly Minions who perform acts of infamy around the world and attempt to recruit new Minions.

64981.name: Ximaera
64981.description:
Ximaera is played on a 3x3 hexagonal board.
There are,off board,sets of three stones for four different types(a total of 12 stones).The stones of one type are called pivots.All stones are neutral and can be used by either player.
On each turn,each player must drop or move one stone.
Pivots may also jump over an adjacent stone.
A player wins by:
1.Connecting three stones of the same kind.
2.If he has no valid move.
3.Opponent repeats a board position for the third time.

64986.name: Unofficial Dungeon Keeper Card Game
64986.description:
From the rulebook:

"So You Want to Become a Dungeon Keeper? Want to Create a Dark Underground Fortress and fill it with Wicked Minions? Want to Create an Evil Empire, bringing Chaos, Death and Destruction? Want to Bash pitiful, useless Heroes? Welcome to the Unofficial Dungeon Keeper Card Game."

"You've got lands (Rooms). You've got Creatures. You've got 20 LifePoints. Just like in magic. Different Rooms are needed to Summon more Creatures, or to research Spells or to build Artifacts, and in general to be more Powerful."

"But there's come the fun part. Creatures can't be anywhere: they must be In a Room. To represent this, you need to put your Creatures near the Rooms they're in. A creature in a Room can defend it, but cannot defend a different Room . . . So be wary not to expand your Dungeon too much, or you will be unable to defend it."

"A Creature in a Room can also use the Room. So, for example, your Warlock in your Library will be able to research a Spell (or to defend the Library). If you want him to defend the Lair, instead, you can move him in the Lair (in the appropriate Turn Phase), but then he will be unable to research a Spell (as he need to be in the Library to do so)."

"You can win in two ways: 1) Kill the Avatar when he's attacking your Dungeon (The World Will Be Mine! Victory), 2) Kill the other Dark Lord (BWHAHA ! Victory)."

64993.name: Speculation: The Dynamic Real Estate Auction Game
64993.description:
Speculation is an auction and strategy game for 2-6 players, built around property acquisition in a metropolitan area. The object of the game is to amass the greatest wealth through property ownership. Players first compete in an auction to purchase options on the various properties. An option gives a player the right to purchase a property, if they can mameuver the token around the board to their property. Since all players maneuver the same token, each player can try to prevent the other players from exercising their options. A player receives from the bank when he moves the token over one of their own properties, and receives from the other players when they move the token over one of his properties. At the end of the game, the player with the greatest amount of money plus property value is declared the winner.

The game ends when the last option is exercised. Any player may exercise the last option, regardless of who holds the option.

64995.description: Taboo variant with cards of different difficulty level (marked in different colors) which yield 1-4 points. Also, each team gets an individual difficulty level, determined by the number of taboo words. The cards are put into a box in which a number of openings can be cleared to display the taboo words (1-4). Thus, the game can be played by adults and kids together (giving the kids less taboo words to worry about). Game ends when a team has reached a premeditated number of points.
